title: A stay meant for comfort quickly turns into distress due to torture-like treatment and consistently rude staff
text: I am writing to formally raise a serious concern regarding the extremely disappointing and unprofessional experience I had during my recent stay at Ira by Orchid, Mumbai. What was meant to be a smooth business trip turned into a stressful and unpleasant experience due to multiple service lapses and unacceptable behaviour from the staff. Despite having a fully prepaid booking and requesting early check-in well in advance via email, we were met with rude and dismissive responses from Mr. Hariharan and Ms. Bindiya upon arrival. While we understood that early check-in may not have been possible, the manner in which this was communicated was inappropriate. When we asked where we could wait, we were directed to an outdoor area referred to as a café, which was extremely unclean and not suitable for guests. After expressing our discomfort, we were informed that Room 205 was ready. However, the condition of the room was unacceptable—there was seepage on the walls, a strong odour, damaged flooring, and broken storage. It was evident that the room should not have been allotted to any guest. A hotel staff member even acknowledged that these issues had been reported earlier, yet the room was still assigned to us. The overall attitude from the staff, especially Mr. Hariharan, who repeatedly interrupted conversations and responded without logic or courtesy, added further frustration. When Mr. Sanjay inspected the room, he immediately recognised the concerns and arranged a change, for which we were grateful. However, the series of issues did not end there. My family came to visit me during the stay, and the night staff refused to allow them to enter the room, citing a policy that had never been communicated at the time of booking or check-in. This created additional distress and made us feel unwelcome. Furthermore, a simple coffee order took almost an hour to be delivered, requiring multiple follow-ups, and we were instructed to clear our food bill mid-stay rather than at checkout, which again reflected an unfriendly approach. Overall, the experience at your property resulted in avoidable stress, inconvenience, and a sense of harassment due to the lack of hospitality and professionalism displayed by several members of your team. I request that this matter be reviewed seriously and appropriate action be taken to ensure no guest is subjected to such treatment in the future. I also expect a formal response addressing the concerns raised.
placeInfo/address: Kurla Rd Near Chakala, Mumbai 400059 India
placeInfo/name: IRA By Orchid Mumbai T2 International Airport

title: Clean and good
text:
The rooms are what you expect, not too big or too small.Bathroom is clean. Amenities are minimal.Service is good.The staff are very helpful and courteous, always ready to do that extra bit. They gave me a small fridge on asking, at no extra charge. Room service is prompt and food is good.The only thing is that for an ordinary hotel food is expensive. Cup of tea  is  Rs 170 - which is way too much. If you order omlette or fried  eggs for breakfast, you have to order toast seperately! That's pretty silly!
There are places nearby for food and one can walk up. Eat outside instead of at the hotel if you don't want to pay the high rates. They arrange local taxi  for airport at regular rate- you should, however, tell them ahead and insist on a clean and ac taxi .

text: Restaurant Staff are Polite and Customer Friendly. Yes. I on regular basis visit Gourmet Restaurant of West End Hotel, Mumbai for having either breakfast or lunch or dinner. This time we 06 colleagues visited this restaurant for having lunch. Out of we 06, two had vegetarian food and four had non-vegetarian food. I am all time strict vegetarian. We ordered mutton and fish among non-vegetarian cuisines and palak-aaloo dish and daal tadka in vegetarian cuisines. Tandoori rotis were superb in taste, as usual. I love tandoori rotis here. Crispy rotis prepared with whole wheat flour only. All items were good in taste. All items were prepared fresh and served in hygienic condition. Service was awesome. Staff are guests friendly and professional. We loved our food!

title: Really in need of some real time check review
text:
Well to begin with i had been here like a day before for a family stay, well as expected the hotel looks exterior well maintained, rustic, prime location but with not so great view.. 
As you walk in the place gets that vintage vibe, rustic interiors from victorian era, dimmed lights huge ceiling fans with decorative central.. Old fashioned sofa, a small corridor and small front desk.. The next to your left is this inhouse restaurant sorry the gourmet restaurant.. 
Well invisit view and exterior view 8/10..
The real review is when you enter the lobby to your room... 
You might feel like walking down some old constructed site along the lobby to those rooms.. And when you enter your desired room which was booked directly with the hotel wasn't ready, you enter and that tacky smell hits you hard as of the room kept shut for a long.. So be prepared to have bad sinusitis if your allergic to such aura around.. They runn ahead to put the ac on.. So that it gets cooler and then ventilated but that doesn't help at all let me bring to your notice firstly if somebody has booked with you, its your duty to keep the room well prepared, and ready for the guest.. Not when they walk your so appointed people (housekeeping guys) runn around to make it fit.. When i said we are family of three its well understood they should make third person bed ready, and worst thing is you dont occupy people into two occupancy area when you're charging the family for triple occupancy. . Bad.. 
Well then after calls and making a stern point we were alloted triple occupancy room.. Thats sad.. Truly.. I don't believ even after havng such great review from people i didn't expect such behavior.. Avoided.. 
Then let me come to interior average interiors just painted n kept as it is since ages so don't expect that what you see from the entrance lobby or outside you will be welcomed to something soo admirable.. 
Old furniture that get stuck, bed thats not at all comfortable.. Fully sloggd mattresses soo be prepared for bad backpain.. Pillows i don't think its even changed soo flat as if used since ages and to mke it littl comfortable you are given cushion pillows.. 
Now let me tell you something more horrible.. Washroom.. I mean i paid huge amount to be entering into a washroom thats tacky with leaking tap of jet spray.. Towels just kept on rack.. A single soap and clinic plus shampoo sachets.. Woww.. In times of covid is that wat hospitality you provide??? 
Well avoid.. Then comes the western seat.. Horrible the  seats are not even replaced soo dicy and shaky seat covers you wouldn't like to touch them ever.. Annoyed to the core.. 
Had to call house keeping guy and ask them to fix it.. Point is was that my job?? Why was my room not checked on regular terms before handling me the keys??? Disgusted.. More to come wait.. 
If you are staying here and come across the board we are open for buffet break fast lunch and dinner.. Do not expect the buffet you feel like a spread would be served.. I was handed some piece of paper with the menu written on it.. Like
Banana, tea/coffee, mendu vada or idli sambar or mini uttapa, then eggs, then bread toast, juices and so onn... 
N then was said to select and say.. M luke then why woudl i step in here wen i was to be asked to speak from that limited menu in my hand.. Arrgh.. Relax more to come.. I stayed calm n ordered.. When we get served remember even after you include breakfast in your stay you will be served the normal filter water.. Bcoz if you want mineral water remember even after including the bf in my stay i had to pay for a bottle of mineral water bcoz only filter water is included in you breakfast.. Woww... Thats truly unacceptable.. 
We quietly had our breakfast for our two daez stay.. N wer just wanting for it to end.. Bcoz more the hype the kitchen has in its guest directory for room service is way beyond any 5star hotel.. 800 for a simple chicken dish.. As we had no option fr our first day u wants to try on the menu.. So we went for nonveg.. Ordered some naan, roti, chicken tikka masala, n fried rice.. Tally of 1500 woww for something that wasn't tasty except the masala of chicken tilla bcoz chicken was undercooked.. N fried rice was tasted full of soda.. The quantity is poor very bad.. You pay soo much fr just a little quantity is unacceptable no matter its gourmet restaurant i do expect something as i wasn't there for free... Truly disappointed.. 
When it comes to housekeeping you call them n they say wll come after 15-20mins woww.... For the first time in my staycation history i found somebody talking to me in such a manner.. The guy comes.. To sweep the floor and clean the washroom.. N wen i ask him about my makin my bed he says that somebody else wl be coming..great i didn't knew housekeeping has segregation into working.. 
You know what after all this i don't even wana write my next day review.. I just wished my two daez stay ends soon n m out of this nightmare.. Never coming back.. As it isnt as expected.. 
Sorry but no sorry.. You really need to renovate from withing especially plzz get the washroom seat covers changed or fixed.. 
Thank you
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Greetings From West End Hotel 

We appreciate your posting this candid feedback for our benefit and pointing out certain drawbacks in our operations for us to learn from. 

I sincerely apologize to you for the discomfort you have had to endure as a result of our being unable to deliver some of the basics and thereby not living up to your expectations. Critical feedback is an extremely motivating force for the hospitality business and since we are in the process of rebuilding our team, it will help us to focus and put in more efforts to train the team to ensure such issues are not repeated with other guests.

We deserve another chance and I am confident that you will notice many positive changes during your future visits to our hotel.

With Warm Regards 

West End Hotel and Team

text:
West End Hotel has continued to retain the excellent service it started with many years ago. Yes, the property is old and the renovations taking place over the past couple of years drove many clients to different hotels. But I recommend giving this hotel a chance. They are located centrally on Marine Lines, close to many landmarks and major sights for tourists. The room rates are ridiculously reasonable (especially if you consider the personalized attendant service) and the in-house restaurant offers wonderful food, even customizing to suit your needs/food restrictions. 

I stayed at this hotel for over a month with my family in 2011 and did so again now in 2020 for the very same reason. Thanks to Mr. Arjun Ramani, Mr. Rahul Dolas, our personal attendants, Sandesh Jadhav, Bharat Patil, Jayant, Chandrakant, the various other helpers, the amazing restaurant managers Mr. Raghavan, Mr. Tanaji and staff, and the wonderful receptionists who always helped us out when needed. 

Keep smiling!

title: Average Hotel, Disappointing Experience
text:
Liked · Staff were generally helpful, friendly and accommodating. Everything worked in the hotel. Shower and AC were good, beds were comfortable and the room clean. Room service was quick and efficient. Check in and check out went smoothly.

Disliked · We booked the family suite based on the pictures on booking.com. However, there was a DRASTIC difference between the room in the pictures and the room we were actually given. (Pictures attached for reference) We did not appreciate this, and while everything in the room was functional and worked properly, (shower and AC were good, beds were comfortable and the room was clean) we felt mislead. The room we got was actually quite old and dated and looked ABSOLUTELY NOTHING like the one in the pictures. When we asked the reception about this, what they told us was that there are 2 family suites, and one was refurbished (the one in the booking.com photos) while the other was not, and that the refurbished room was already booked. They made an effort to offer us another 2-bed room but it was not sufficient for our group in terms of bed / sleeping arrangements so we had to make due.

We purchased 5 cans of craft beer from a mall to take back home with and stored them in the fridge in the room during our stay. However on the 3rd day, one can was stolen from the fridge during the day while we were out. We weren't about to go to the police over a can of beer, however this was utterly disappointing and what was most troubling was no one took any responsibility for this or made any sort of effort to either replace the beer can or reduce the cost, despite us complaining to the front desk as soon as we realized, as well as prior to leaving. (This was a relatively expensive German craft beer and could not be purchased from any area nearby). Stealing, however small an item, is wrong on all levels and we were completely disappointed by this.

We had to be sure to either lock up every little thing we had, or carry things with us on our person whenever we left the room after this happened as we did not have the confidence or trust to leave things around the room.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: A Wonderful Stay with Warm Hospitality and Unique Local Charm
text:
I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at The Retreat Hotel & Convention Centre. What makes this place truly stand out is the exceptionally polite and courteous staff. It’s heartwarming to know that many of them are from the local fishing communities around the hotel, which brings a genuine sense of warmth and authenticity to the service. Their smiles and helpful attitude made my experience memorable and special.

The rooms are very comfortable, and if you opt for a higher category room, you’re in for a rare Bombay treat—you may catch the awe-inspiring sight of eagles soaring just outside your window! It’s magical and something that elevates the stay far above the usual city hotel experience.

The pool and health club facilities are simply fantastic—well-maintained, inviting, and perfect for relaxation or a refreshing workout. Every visit here feels like a recharge for my spiritual batteries.

Food and beverage options are good, though I do feel they have scope to improve. The encouraging part is that the management takes all feedback very seriously and strives to make constant improvements on this front.

All in all, The Retreat is much more than just a hotel—it’s a sanctuary of calm, with a caring team, unique local touches, and a serene environment. Always a comfortable, relaxed stay that leaves me feeling refreshed and recharged. Highly recommended!

A big thank you to the staff and a special mention to Rahil from the front desk and Felix from the coffee shop to make our stay near perfect!
placeInfo/address: Madh Island Marve Road Malad West, Mumbai 400061 India

title: 10/10 on everything!
text:
The Retreat is an exceptional venue for a wide variety of events. I was here as part of a residential business workshop for 3 days. From the moment I stepped onto the property, the staff were extremely welcoming and helpful. I had a late night check-in, and it was smoothly taken care of by the front office staff. 

The room was spotless, well maintained, spacious, and full of all the amenities you could possibly want. The housekeeping staff was very diligent and discrete in their duties - I was never disturbed and the room was still made spotless by the staff every day. 

The hall in which the workshop was held was easily accessible, spacious, and fit for the purpose of our gathering. Hotel staff was constantly available for any assistance during our workshop. The staff also regularly check in on us and kept us refreshed with tea, coffee, and snacks.

Coming to the food, I had high expectations considering my positive experience thus far, and I am pleased to say that my expectations were surpassed. We experienced the buffet service for 3 days, and each time they surprised us with new items on the menu. I tried vegetarian as well as non vegetarian options, and ALL of the items were super tasty. Hats off to the team! 

After work, I explored the property and felt that its an especially promising and fun getaway destination for families as well. I spent considerable time in the clubhouse playing table tennis and foosball (and there are other options like Billiards, carrom, swimming pool, volleyball, etc). You can also visit the beach during the day, it's hardly 2 minutes away by foot.

Extremely satisfied with my stay at The Retreat and I recommend it for business/solo travelers and families.
placeInfo/address: Madh Island Marve Road Malad West, Mumbai 400061 India

title: RELAXATION PARADISE
text:
Best hotel if you want an out of city experience in the city itself . It is located away from the hustle and bustle of Mumbai , despite being in Mumbai .

1) Rooms - The rooms are very comfortable . Take the sea view option . It is approximately a thousand more , but worth the money . Again , first try for A wing , then B wing . View from A wing is the best . Avoid C wing , if possible ( view not the best ) . Try for higher floors 7 , 6 or 5 , else the coconut trees will block the sea view . If you are a big group , then request for interconnecting rooms in advance .

2) Food . Tangerine cafe is the 24 x 7 coffee shop . It is also the place for breakfast , lunch and dinner buffets . Oriental Bowl is the a la carte Chinese restaurant . When you book the stay , go for the MAP plan ( breakfast , 1 major meal - lunch or dinner , and afternoon tea ) . The hotel does not offer an AP plan ( all meals included ) . There is no nearby restaurant , so if you dont take the MAP plan , then you have to order A la carte from the hotels restaurants , which are on the higher side . Pro tip - There is a restaurant around 10 minutes drive from the hotel . Name of the restaurant is BOLLYWOOD STARS . They deliver meals to the hotel lobby , from where you can collect and eat in your room . Food is quite delicious and reasonably priced . Dont forget to tell Bollywood Stars to include cutlery ( wooden spoons and paper plates and bowls ) . Else you have to pay the Retreat for additional cutlery .

3) Service - Very very good service . If I could give them 6 stars , I would , but google allows only 5 stars . Mr. Ritesh Gupta
( Assistant front desk manager ) , was very professional and helpful . His promptness and efficiency ensured a smooth check in and enjoyable stay . Mr Felix , of the Tangerine Cafe was a superstar , who made our stay memorable with his attention and supervision . Mr Shon in the service staff of Tangerine Cafe , looked after us very nicely . I did not encounter a single rude staff . I found some guests talking to the hotel staff in a derogative manner and they got it back in the same tone . But if you are courteous and kind with the hotel staff , they will be the same , and will look after you nicely . Dont forget to hand out tips ( they deserve it ) .

4) Things to do - First the free activities . The huge pool and Jacuzzi . Beach is average ( full of strong fish smell , which sometimes can be smelt in the hotel open premises also for a few hours of the day ) . Try the Retreat Club games room which has many games . Go for the Steam bath ( after the swim , never before a swim ) . Beach volleyball , badminton , cycling . All these activities are free activities included in your stay . Spa is good ( paid activity) . Air Hockey and Billiards are reasonably priced . Spend maximum time inside the hotel . Nearby activities are not that great . Example Madh Fort ( you cant go inside without prior permission )

5) Location - It is located at a very remote part of Mumbai . Be sure to get there during daytime and leave during daytme . Incase of a car breakdown , it will be very difficult to get help after sunset . The nearby roads are not well lit during night. Taxis and autos are hard to find .

All in all , a very refreshing change from the fast paced Mumbai life.
placeInfo/address: Madh Island Marve Road Malad West, Mumbai 400061 India

title: 有歷史的老飯店
text:
起源於1948的飯店，硬體都較老舊（古董）但還算乾淨，硬體包含椅子、桌子、床、衣櫃、衛浴設備、電扇、冷氣。 床不太好睡，棉被也只有薄薄的一層（薄毯子＋床單）。服務很好，餐點普通，電梯很復古有特色。目前有部分房間在改裝更新中，日後硬體設備應該會較好。 

地點不錯，樓下附近吃東西算方便，走到Victoria Terminus火車站也不遠。坐計程車到Fort區和Colaba區都很近。

主要都是當地印度人去住，很特別的經驗。

整體來說個人認為價位偏高。

title: Colonial Era guest house ; rooms don't have tea/coffee makers or mini-fridge
text:
Can't imagine staying in any decent hotel in today's era that does not have either tea/coffee maker or mini-fridge. It had an in-room safe which was surprising. 
Absolutely retro colonial era hotel. Old worn out wooden furniture. Smell of dampness was unmistakable. 
The bathtub had a used soap bar. 
Rooms open with a physical key and you have to put the plastic keychain into socket to have power.
Cleanliness was good - bathroom was very clean and actually much better than the room itself. Absolutely nothing to look out to - infect cant even open curtains as you end up looking into people's apartments and vice versa.
Stairs are more user friendly than the aged elevators - one needs to open a door, then open a sliding grill and same procedure to close. So one does this twice for any one way trip. Far easier and faster to take the stairs.

The saving grace was the dining area - service there was good. 

Hotel has an all Male staff everywhere - most of them are middle aged and some certainly close to 60 yrs.

I didn't stay here by choice and certainly wouldn't do it in future
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

 

Thank you for taking time out to review West End. We regret that the hotel did not meet your expectations. We have room service/butler service round the clock & tea/coffee is available 24x7.

Mini-fridge is available on request for base category rooms & superior rooms already have mini-fridge.

 

Bathtub has liquid soap dispensers. We try to preserve heritage feel of hotel, that’s why the lifts are new but with caged door. In the monsoon little dampness is there & we do have dehumidifier to minimize dampness. Thank you for appreciating our cleanliness & restaurant service.

 

If you can give us another chance of serving you again. We will recommend you to try our newly renovated rooms & our team will make every effort to make your stay a happy one.

 

Yours Faithfully,

 

  Arjun Ramani

General Manager
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Mrs Meetu Soni
text: West End is a truly exceptional hotel! The architecture is unique - one of the finest Art Deco buildings in the city. But it is the people which really make the place special. The hospitality of Mr Ramani, Rahul, Felix and the whole team is tremendous. West End is rare in that it has been family owned and managed for 70 years - meaning continuity of experience and commitment to values (which is so hard to find these days). The West End buffet at the Gourmet Restaurant is legendary - and with good reason. As is the historic Chez Nous snug bar. The food is consistently delicious and has a super range of classic dishes - both Indian and continental. It is near impossible to find larger rooms in Mumbai! Whether staying alone, with a family or large groups - West End will alway accommodate at a high quality and with attention detail. I can’t imagine travelling to Mumbai to stay anywhere else - it is a home away from home because of the people and their love of hospitality.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Charme d'un viel hotel

Le personnel est aimable et attentionné.Les repas sous forme de buffet ont un bon rapport qualité/prix. Il est possible d'avoir un service de restauration en chambre. Les petits déjeuners compris dans le prix sont copieux.
La wifi était gratuite pendant les quatre jours de notre séjour. Le journal était posé à notre porte chaque matin.
Cet hôtel est situé dans un quartier populaire. Il est proche de certains lieux touristiques. Il est possible d'avoir une voiture pour les visites plus éloignées.
Nous recommanderons cet hôtel aux amis qui souhaitent un tourisme "d'immersion"

title: Pas honnête
text:
L’hôtel en soit est plutôt bien situé dans un quartier animé. Les chambres sont correctes et nous avons même eu une salle de bain  avec baignoire. 
Nous déplorons que le service de transfert vers l’aéroport que l’hôtel mentionné sur hotels.com ne soit pas disponible.
Et surtout que la piscine (raison pour laquelle nous avions porté notre choix sur cet hôtel en particulier) ne soit pas disponible pendant 3 mois ! L’hôtel s’était bien gardé de le mentionner sur le site de réservation.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
Greetings from Ramee Guestline Hotel, Dadar!
Thank you for sharing your feedback with us regarding your recent stay at our hotel. We regret to hear about your disappointment and apologize for any inconvenience caused.

Regarding the airport transfer service, we apologize for any miscommunication. Please note that airport transfers are subject to availability and may incur additional charges. However, for guests booking Suite rooms through certain platforms like booking.com, one-way airport transfer is complimentary.

We understand your frustration about the swimming pool closure. Please be informed that our rooftop restaurant is undergoing renovations, which includes the pool area. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused during your stay.

We appreciate your feedback, as it helps us improve our services. If you have any further concerns or if there's anything we can assist you with, please don't hesitate to contact us directly.

Warm regards,
Johnson Madtis

title: LOCATION
text:
Main advantage about this hotel in my view is the location, next to Dadar station and access to other parts of Mumbai.  To me the hotel  is probably graded as a 4 star because of the swimming pool.  The breakfast was more like 2 star service and the chef's not eager to accommodate hotel guests. The room keys did not function most of the time and we had to keep going back to the reception to validate them.  I would say security is concern as anyone walk in and have access to all the floors.  I felt they were stingy as they seem to control what essentials were given out.  Have given 3 star simply because the front desk manager Mr Abhimanyu Shedge had courtesy to sit down and hear out our concerns and apolosise.
We will probably stay here in future simply because of the location, as it is convenient to our needs.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We appreciate your kind words about the advantageous location of our hotel near Dadar station, which offers convenient access to various parts of Mumbai. Your rating of 4 stars based on our swimming pool is also noted.

We apologize for any inconvenience you faced with the breakfast service and the behavior of our chef. We will definitely address this concern with our team to ensure a better experience for our valued guests like you. Additionally, we apologize for the issue with the room keys and the accessibility concern you raised. Your feedback will be taken into consideration for further improvements.

We understand your observation about the control of essentials and appreciate your feedback on it. We will review our practices to ensure a more satisfactory experience for our guests.

Thank you for acknowledging the courtesy and attentiveness of our Manager, Mr. Abhimanyu Shedge. We will share your kind words with him, and we are delighted to hear that he was able to address your concerns.

We look forward to welcoming you back to our hotel in the future, as we value your loyalty and understand the convenience our location offers to meet your needs. Please feel free to reach out to us if you have any further suggestions or concerns.

Warm regards,
Amit Srivastava
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Opp. Swami Narayan Temple Dadar (E), Mumbai, Mumbai 400014 India

title: Great dining experience at rasoi restaurant
text: I visited this restaurant rasoi, located at dadar in ramee guestline hotel. It was a restaurant with great ambience, superb food, nice music & good service. I ordered for the Caribbean mocktail, which was a mix of Mango juice, pineapple n  other juices along with coconut milk. It was amazing, similar to pinacolade but with a twist. I ordered 2 starters which were,  mutton sheekh kebab and fish tikka. I was impressed by both of the starters,  they were soft n flavourful.  I really enjoyed it.  Next I ordered the Thai curry with prawns,  it was served along with rice. I also tried the butter chicken with garlic cheese Naan. I t tasted amazing.  I loved every thing I ordered here. Delicious food. Lastly I tried the dessert which was their house special kesar kulfi with falooda and this dessert was very well presented on paan leaves garnished with rose petals. It tasted amazing. I had an amazing dining experience here. Must visit if you're in Mumbai.
placeInfo/address: Opp. Swami Narayan Temple Dadar (E), Mumbai, Mumbai 400014 India

title: Suite room was good.
text: I booked suite room through MMT at last moment so it was costlier and room only, i requested manager to give complimentary breakfast, first he denied by saying it is online booking they can't help but later cooperated on our request and given complimentary breakfast. Room was spacious, little classical look. Mini bar was full of stuff. Room has dining table, sofa, king sized bed, tub, etc. There was only obstacle of one round pillar in room near cupboard. Little old property but maintained. Restaurants were good, one was south indian and one was bar with restaurant. Food quality was good with music. Breakfast has less spread but ok. Staff is cooperative, they helped to carry bag and park vehicle. It was good to have car parking near premium location like Dadar station. Overall good experience.

title: Worst Experience Ever
text:
One of the worst properties I have ever come across, for starters the smell is unbearable, followed by abnoctiously rude staff.

Followed by bad service and an awful, dinner and breakfast spread, the bread had fungus which the staff refused to acknowledge.

Staff member named Rahil at the reception was highly unprofessional and infact he is the one who urged me to write this review stating, please go ahead and write wherever, whatever you wish to.
ownerResponse/responder: The Retreat Hotel and  Convention Centre
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ms.Sonam, 

We would like to thank you for choosing our hotel as your accommodation choice and for taking the time to post a review about your experience. Re your feedback, whilst we apologize to you any inconvenience, we would like to state the following -

The hotel is located in a coastal fishing hamlet and the smell you refer to is prevalent at times.  

As you are aware your booking was coordinated by Mr Sudesh Tamhane. At the time of the booking there was no request made for interconnecting rooms and upon check-in (on 8-March), you asked for 8 sets of interconnecting rooms. Unfortunately, we could only offer you the 1 (one) vacant available set. 

You checked in at around 1730 hours, when the hi tea service was over and the service timings of this meal were communicated by email to Mr Tamhane during your booking time. 

Your group members bought their own alcoholic beverages to the hotel which is in order. However, you demanded that the same be served in a banquet venue or the lawns. It was explained to Mr Tamhane during booking time that service of liquor in any area outside the licensed areas, would need the procurement of a license in advance and that guests could consume their own liquor in their room only.  

We offer all our guests a standard buffet breakfast comprising of fruit juices, choice of cut fresh fruits, choice of cereals, assorted breakfast rolls, toast, eggs to order, dosa counter, apart from 3 Indian hot items, 2 continental items and other accompaniments. Should guests feel the need to order additional items (like sausages, meats, etc), they do order items on an a la carte basis. There was no fungus on bread and the same was acknowledged by the Restaurant Manager at that time. Whilst your feedback on the contents of the buffet are duly noted, this is one of the rare instances when we have received such feedback.

Your entire booking was coordinated by Mr.Tamhane and all do’s and don’ts were explained to him via email. Unfortunately it appears that these were not communicated by Mr Tamhane to the group, hence the negative experience that you encountered at the hotel and the hotel or its team cannot be held responsible for this. You would recall that your group member (Mr Ratan) used inappropriate language in the lobby in the presence of other guests for no fault of the hotel As you are aware, Mr Tamhane was unreachable during this interaction in the lobby (at around 1900 hrs).on 8 March.  

We are happy to share with you a copy of the email exchange with Mr Sudesh during the booking period.

We hope in the light of what is mentioned above, you would view the matter in the correct perspective and we stay committed to providing you with wonderful experiences!

Warm Regards
placeInfo/address: Madh Island Marve Road Malad West, Mumbai 400061 India

title: Avoid at all costs!
text: Staff at the door were great couldn't fault that however as soon as you get to the hotel door there is a very strong smell of fish which is really sickening.  Reception staff were ok just followed the script and charged us extra to have an extra bed for a child to stay with us even though tje bed didn't fit in the room booked ( no Invoixe given for this payment taken) so the child had to sleep in my bed whole night which was very uncomfortable as 3 people In 1 double bed was very uncomfortable.  I booked this hotel based on the pool and being on the beach but wasn't able to use either as the smell was worse and when questioned was told fish is being dried on tje beach by the locals so this was a waste as had to go back and had to check out as the smell was unbeatbale the room was old dated and very dusty and looked liked someone hadn't stayed or cleaned in a while). Picture aren't what it seems. Not worth the money as even getting a taxi from here was a nightmare due to the location being in the middle of nowhere
placeInfo/address: Madh Island Marve Road Malad West, Mumbai 400061 India

title: Good stay for short one day get away
text:
The hotel is a comfortable place to stay. The swimming pool is well maintained . Did not see a pool attendant for the 2 hrs we used the pool though.
 Archi at the check in was very welcoming and extremely quick to do her job. Was efficient at check out as well.

There was no information of the complimentary hi tea any where in our reservation confirmation also was not informed on arrival. Got to know the same by room service when I tried to order tea late afternoon.
Food overall quality is good. Had ala carte lunch in the coffee shop which was pretty good and service was brilliant. The (female) captain at the coffee shop was extremely courteous.
Ordered dinner from room service which was very good and served hot.
Manav was excellent at breakfast service.

Room HK-
Requested an HK staff for evening service when was near the elevator . She just got the bathroom touched up and placed fresh towels. It would be  a nice gesture to touch up the bed as well.

Wanted to meet the GM for a feedback on a safety issue which i had on mind. I was informed that he was not available and hence met the Lobby manager.
The glass table tops in the entire hotel ( guest rooms , coffee shop  etc) have extremely sharp edges. Considering  that you cater to so many families this is an  area of safety concern  with children around the hotel specifically the ones who are as tall as your table tops.

Never heard back from the GM on the feedback despite leaving back my credentials. not sure if feed back was taken constructively.

Over all good place to stay
ownerResponse/responder: The Retreat Hotel and  Convention Centre

title: A property in decay - AVOID
text:
I recall going to the Retreat 5 years back, much to my disappointment the property has now decayed to one of horror.

Be it the beach which is filled with garbage and dead animals, making it impossible to even take a stroll on; or the staff which rather than focusing on giving guests a good experience is focused on fleecing guests for every arbitrary reason possible. The rooms have enough dust to start a dust storm in merely patting the curtains and are akin to what one would find in a haunted mansion.

Sad to see a great property in Bombay decay to this extent into one which is little better than a budget guest house

Would urge all to stay away at all costs and not spend their valuable money at this nightmare of a property

Food is amazing. Try the Chinese for lunch and a hearty buffet at night. 

The staff is warm and helpful. Ask for Disha at the check in and you will be treated in the true definition of hospitality. Hospitality is about prioritizing client experience and not revenue, and who knows it better than Disha.

Staff Sanjeev at the restaurant had a never say die attitude willing to do beyond ordinary to accommodate our demands.

The play area needs a make over.

Out in out a brilliant experience. Money well spent.

title: Reliving the days of the Raaj
text:
Set in the year 1941, this hotel is a true example of the old days of the British era mixed with modernization. I booked a suite for my family ( 3 of us ) but the suite turned out to be big enough for 5. The ceiling, furniture, crockeries, curtains, everything points to the history of the hotel. 

In fact, the elevator has an old-school lift guy who would not allow you to touch buttons. Coming to location, this hotel is located opposite to Bombay hospital. Walking distance from Marina Lines station. The street is busy with a lot of food vendor options and there's an Irani restaurant like 300 meters from the place, which serves amazing breakfast food. 

Staff? well again, the guys are old school. Old testimony as they say. The hotel staff will be happy if you tip them the day 1. My advice, don't save money on tips if you need the best of services. If you tip them nice they will treat you as kings and that's how it should be in a hotel. 

I paid around INR 8200/- for a suite ( with taxes ) 130$ for that kind of services were great. A memorable experience none  the less
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing such an encouraging & detailed review. We are delighted to read your comments on our heritage look (ceiling, furniture, crockeries, and curtains) location and spacious rooms. We try our best to preserve heritage look of our hotel which many guests such as you appreciate. However I would like to sincerely apologize for the tipping impression you got about our hotel.I would like to clarify to you and other readers that, we constantly train our staff in customer service and in values such as honesty and what you describe is certainly not acceptable practice. 

Your comments have been discussed with the entire team and you can be assured this will not reoccur within West End. We hope to see you back in West End next visit to Mumbai.

Yours Faithfully,

             Rahul Dolas
Business Development Manager
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Staff great however Cleanliness & Food a real issue very disappointing at times
text:
This hotel is under refurb however that should never effect the general hygeine or tidyness of rooms. When we drove up I was shocked , the younger reception staff seemed dis interested and it had a musty dejected feel to the whole place , Furniture and fittings were old and unclean.

Our room had all the curtains drawn when we pulled them back we realised why the outside area at the back of the hotel looked like a bomb site , the small juliet balconeys were covered in debris dust and pigeon droppings and seemed unstable , the doors and windows did not shut properly and there was such a bad damp musty smell i purchased air freshners from the nearby chemist shop which didnt help much.

There were bare wires ,musty wardrobes  adisgusting  filthy fridge , plaster falling off walls doors that didnt shut , ancient air con , damp patches and the rugs were covered in hair dust and stains this was in the best one as they showed us 4 others before we settled on it in desperation.

The line is old torn and stained the mattresses bulked out with sunlounger cushions so uncomfortable i gave up sleeping , The fans sounded like steam trains and everything was mucky dusty and old i was gobsmacked.

The windowless bar was musty but staff good , watch your bills my advice pay as u go dont book to your room there were a few wrong bills as people i saw checked out. 

Lifts wer old but worked ok but the one lift was out of action that led to queues at peak times.

Room service was cheap but hte flask brought with my coffee in looked like it had come from a building site it was filthy.

Food was ok they need more european choice for breakfast as apart from toast you had had it. 

All in all we stayed put because it was a good location , staff mostly very helpful but for the price which wasnt a budget price considering the hotels under renovation and had has lifts not working , rooms out of service etc was high for such a poor quality they need to address the cleaning/hygene  issues as even a newly renovated room if not cleaned properly will be dire in a few months. 

Replace dust mite infested curtains , upgrade linens and towels , sweep rooms thoroughly and if you cant clean mats dont have the in the rooms , Get rid of fridges they are a health hazard . replaster and make safe wiring. 

Offer better choices on the buffett and make sure drink tabs are sorted for customers
I wouldnt stay again
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
               
    Thank you for taking time out to review West End. You were part of wedding group of 100 people occupying 40 rooms. It was a British wedding from 20th October 2017 to 29th October 2017 chosen to be held in Mumbai than in any other part of the world. So it was a very prestigious booking for our hotel which is a heritage & economy hotel.
                   The couple Mr. Daniel & Ms. Kirsty were very excited & so were all of us at the West End to give all the guests our very best services. We tried our best but we are very sorry that we did not meet your expectation. Perhaps, it is due to renovation work which caused dust & noise. At the time of booking we had informed that the renovation is going on .Because of renovation work for the security reasons the Balcony were barricaded therefore couldn’t be used. We deeply regret the inconvenience caused to you. Your hosts had stayed here on 2 previous occasions & on the strength of those 2 comfortable visits they booked with us. We deeply regret the inconvenience caused to you & we thank you for your patience & understanding. Please stay with us in the future in our new hotel which will have high standard of hygiene, cleanliness & maintenance.  
                    We hope you will give us another chance to serve you in the future & thank you for appreciating our staff & location.

Yours Faithfully,

           Arjun Ramani
          General Manager
   West End Hotel, Mumbai
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Location & People !!
text:
On 24th April as my mother was unwell, on emergency we had to admit her to Bombay Hospital. As she was in ICU & there was no place to stay for patients relative in hospital, I checked into Hotel West End, which is just next door. I end up staying there for 2 weeks & only returned home on 6th May once my mother recovers completely & was discharged from Bombay Hospital. 
West End is located "just" for Bombay Hospital, so incase of any unfortunate situation where once' close one is admired in Bombay Hospital, this is THE place to stay. Location is also very good for those who want to visit Mumbai to see cricket match or have work in south Mumbai as Wankhede Stadium is just a stone throw away. And so is the marine drive, metro cinema, Flora fountain etc. 
The staff is really amazing, right from darbans to reception to lift to restaurant to house keeping ... very friendly and helpful staff. I must thank each & every one for making my stay comfortable. 
Property is almost 70 years old & certainly not been maintained to the mark. Needs renovation "everywhere" !! I have notice certain renovation work & hope that the management does complete make over of property. As it's a old property & not been maintained up to date, most of the time one doesn't find many people (guests) & that makes property dull !! 
Hope management will completely revamp the property & post that this property will regain its past glory!! 
Wishing all the staff a very good luck & thanks for all the support !!
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Basic
text: On arrival this hotel seemed quite grand as the gentleman who was on duty to greet us outside the hotel had all the regalia on and looked very impressive. But inside this good impression wasn't reflected, although the hotel was undergoing renovation. The reception looked tired and unstylish. We were taken to our room by the lift operator. The room was spacious but dated and needed a refurb. But it was clean. We did not use the restaurant however we did go in the bar and had a pleasant surprise. The service was wonderful and when we ordered drinks we were given a load of snacks too which were constantly refilled. This was more like a five star bar, cosy with friendly clientele. Hopefully the rest of the hotel will be upgraded and more stylish when the renovations are complete.

title: Pretty good choice
text:
I stayed in the hotel in Dec-16 for a week, this is a very good choice in this area. 
Here is the summary:

Pros:
- Rooms are big and well lit, bright.
- Service is very good.
- Has an in-house restaurant, which functions well. 
- Next to Bombay hospital, in a market area where you will find everything
- Are is well connected, so you will get taxi/auto and cabs round the clock
- Very close to Nariman point, New marine lines local station, churchgate, shivaji park and other prime areas. 

Cons (mostly minor):
- Its a very crowded and busy area, so always noisy. The glass windows and doors reduce the noise upto a good level, still. 
- The building is pretty old, and has limited parking space
- The surroundings are not very pleasant, many people sleeping on footpath around the hotel. 
- Slightly overpriced, considering no free breakfast and internet
- Front desk staff can be more warm and welcoming (like the other staff)

Overall a very good choice in this area, for good service, excellent rooms and good connectivity.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking time out to review West End. We appreciate your positive comments on Rooms, Service & location. 

       We have conveyed your feedback to the front office team & it will surely help them to improve. We have different tariffs Room only, B & B,MAP, AP & inclusive of WI-FI also. You can opt for any of these packages for your next stay. Look forward to welcoming you again soon.

Yours Faithfully,

        Arjun Ramani
     General Manager
West End Hotel, Mumbai

title: Disgraceful customer service
text:
Arriving at 2am on a Friday night, we were greeted by the night manager informing us that our booking for 4 doubles had been downgraded to 2 rooms with 4 single beds (of which half were camp beds) in each. There was no apology and no acknowledgement that this was a less than ideal situation. They said this was due to renovation then, when pushed, due to 'an incident', then when pushed further 'people didn't check out' and then finally that they had overbooked.

Overbooking is understandable on occasion, but to be lied to several times on the reason for the change and to only be informed on arrival was outrageous service from the hotel. They said they had tried to contact us, but this was only at 6pm the same day when we were on a flight already and by this stage way too late for us to change. 

When we asked for a refund, they said that they can't do that as we booked online, failing to accept that what they were offering us was not the rooms we had paid for. The lack of acknowledgement from staff that our situation was unprofessional and after a long discussion only offering to give us free wifi as a refund wholly inadequate. 
Only through the online booking company were we ultimately able to get half refund for the first night's stay.

Compared to similar hotels in the price range in the area, the rooms were terrible and the 4 single beds they provided us not appropriate for a group including 2 couples. 

We were moved to 4 doubles the next day, but there was no apology or acknowledgement of the stress and inadequate service they provided to us.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest
 
Thank you for taking the time to share your stay experience with us.
 
Please accept my sincere apologies for the problems you have encountered and the lack of empathy my team displayed upon your arrival. It is of the utmost importance to us that the service as well as the product afforded to our guests be of the highest standards.
 
I sincerely appreciate the opportunity to strengthen our associates customer service skills and have used your comments to coach my team on how we may better handle the rare occasions on when the hotel is overbooked.
 
We clearly failed in meeting your expectations and regretfully did not handle the situation in a caring manner. While you may have lost faith in the West End Hotel I sincerely hope you will give us another opportunity and contact me directly the next time your travels bring you back to Mumbai.
 
I look forward to the opportunity to restore your faith in us.
 

Warm regards,

Arjun Ramani
General Manager
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Budget hotel in a great location
text:
This hotel has one big factor going for it - location. It is a 10 minute walk from Marine Drive, and the Churchgate local train station is also within walking distance. The hotel has an old world charm to it, but nothing much seems to have changed since then. Rooms are very spacious but a bit musty due to the carpet flooring. The bathrooms were clean and well maintained. The rooms could do with some better lighting though.
WiFi is paid, and quite expensive. We did not try the WiFi at the hotel, 3G/4G is quite dependable in this area for all basic use.
The breakfast is a good spread - make sure to try the poori/aloo and poha, they were very well made. The staff are courteous and willing to help.
Do not expect any luxury or frills whatsoever. At its current rate, the hotel packs in good value for money in a city where rent and food are a great strain on the wallet otherwise.
Traveller tip - Do try having the masala chai from the street vendors parked right next to the hotel (opposite Bombay Hospital), it is amazing!
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

text:

Average breakfast.

title: Disappointing hotel..no old world charm in a business area
text:
Was not given a good room, request for change for rejected.  The rooms balcony overlooked a dilapidated building.  Room was smelly, dirty carpet, frayed cushion covers, broken chairs, smelly cupboards.  Definitely the room was very big in size, but whats the use, if you don't want to use every part of the room, being so rotten. Seems they have renovated bathrooms.  It was the best place inside the room.  The Veg breakfast was poor, even tea was peculiar which I didn't like.  Hence, after that I even had morning tea outside the hotel.  Recommended only if you have work in that area and have no other option.  Which unfortunately was my case.

Does not exude the old world charm at all.  Badly needs renovation.

title: Average Experience
text:
I visited here for my daughters exam. We have booked this hotel, as exam was to be conduced there only.
Check in was smooth. But managers lack professionalism. Lobby was attractive but rooms were of vintage style. 
Being a 4 star property room and bathroom both lacked basic amenities like tea-coffee maker, mini bar. There was only a shampoo pouch in the bathroom.
I was shocked to know that WiFi was chargeable. 
Rooms were big enough, room service was quick. location is wonderful.
But not value for money at all. They charged more than 4000 per night only for room.
You can get many other option in this price range.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Royal Colonial Treat
text:
Pros: 
•	The Colonial atmosphere.
•	Extra courteous staff.
•	Location – proximity to CST, Fashion Street, Gateway of India, Taj Hotel, Colaba Causeway
•	Nearby cinemas.
•	Decent food.

Cons: 
•	Doors that don’t lock.
•	Dangerously slippery bath.
•	No free Wi-Fi (even paid is not up to the mark).
•	No swimming pool.
•	No gym.

The moment I landed inside I felt as if I’ve taken a time machine and travelled 50 years back to enjoy the colonial hospitality. Every bit of this hotel reeks colonial. 

Established in 1948, the hotel management has probably taken special care to ensure that the people who stay here feel so. 

Be it the buildings, dark corridors, double door (inside & outside) lifts that need operators, antique tables and chairs, mirrors, shelves, extra-long sofas, and even the external electrical wiring remind us of the pre / post-independence era. And have you found a Coin-operated phone anywhere these days? And a Phone Tariff card that reads out separate rates for local calls & STD calls ?!? I’m not sure to which era they belong, and whether anyone uses these facilities !!!

What more, even the shortfalls of the hotel like leaking taps and creaking lifts, and the odour in the room till A/C  cools to its full level remind us of 1950s. 

But then you’ll definitely enjoy if you don’t mind these. Where will you find people run to you and ask whether you want something, the moment you step out of your room? And where will you find them asking every time whether your room should be cleaned? Where will you find a person in coat & suite running out to operate a lift for you? You really feel ROYAL in West End. 

On the downside, some people feel this is on a bit expensive side. Add to this you do not have a pool or a gym, you need to buy cards to enable Wi-Fi & that connects to only one gadget, the not so great (but not bad too) food all add to the negative side. Also, the proximity (almost the same compound) to the ever busy Bombay Hospital, rushing ambulances, and bee-line of beggars all decimate the charm of the hotel. 

However, my only complaint about West End was the bath. They’ve tried modernising the bath, and in course of this action they’ve used super polished black granite in the bath which neither reveals the wetness nor helps us balance. Every time I came out of the shower, during the five day stay here, only I know how many gymnastics I had to learn to keep my head and limbs intact. God these bath rooms can directly throw into the next compound (pun intended). 

I hope they do something about it before someone is really harmed.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: BIG Rooms_Vintage Style_Good Service
text:
Had an amazing time staying at this hotel. The rooms are Really BIG and Spacious with a vintage touch. The ambiance and service gives you great vibes. Location is just Supreme. Food is delicious and nicely served. 
I would say it is one of the finest Hotel in South Bombay at an affordable price.

title: Conveneintly Located Family Hotel
text:
It is a conveniently located Family Hotel. Mumbai VT & Churchgate terminus is just about 1km,  Mumbai central too is less then 4kms. It is next to Bomaby Hospital and close to Kalbadevi Zaveri bajar & Crawford market.Lots of good eateries are around to suit most of the tastes and pockets.

It is an old hotel & maintenance & ambience is far from being lively & pleasant. Rooms are specious but the interior is dull. Hotel management is rigid about their rules. They wont allow you early check-in or late check-out even by an hour. They don't seem to make the stay customers delight.

title: A lovely Hotel
text: We used this hotel for a brief stop during a sight seeing tour to Mumbai. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms very spacious and comfortable. The hotel has a great restaurant and a delightful bar where you can chil after a hard days sightseeing with a cocktail or a beer. Would use gain. Thank you.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Decent Hotel
text:
I stayed at the West End in Mumbai for one day. I was on a business trip and the location of my meeting was within walking distance to the hotel. This influenced my choice of a hotel. The West End was decent and good value for money. The building is old but is fairly well maintained. The bathrooms have been re-done and are modern enough (even if a little small). It is right next to Bombay hospital, on a busy little road, but the noise level wasn't much (maybe because I had a back-facing room away from the street). 

As I entered the room, it smelled a little musty because it had not been aired. It was a corner single room and no air circulation. But once I turned on the AC and the fan, it was fine. Perhaps they can air the room in advance if they are expecting a guest and know they will be allotting the room. 

Everything else was utility driven and adequate.  Room service was quick; the buffet breakfast was fine, with variety and sufficient for anyone's needs, and attentive restaurant personnel. 

Generally no complaints - except one: which I pointed out to the front desk: if we buy a 300 Rs. coupon for wifi (for one day), it allows us to log in to only one device. So if I want to use my laptop, I have to logout of the phone and vice versa. I suggested that they ask their vendor to allow multiple devices with the same coupon code (since we use more than one device most of the time!). In many other hotels we stay in, we get FREE wifi service with check in. Here, not only we had to pay (Per hour or per day), but it was restricted to one device at a time. Maybe they can work on this.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: correct but a bit overpriced
text: The location is good and the service is friendly. It must be said that rooms are spacious and, apart from a bed and wardrobe, have a sofa, arm-chairs, a table and TV. Everything was just enough to be OK but no more. There is no free internet, which is important when on the go. We chose this hotel only because if was discounted 40% and I was OK with the quality-price. However, during check out, they added luxury and other taxes which made room's price shoot up. If you are asked to pay under 3.500-4.000 Rs max per a double, go for it. If more, it's not worth it.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Comfortable, ideally located and reasonably priced
text: I have stayed many times at this centrally located hotel. The rooms which I have had are large and airy and clean, quiet and comfortable. The staff are friendly and welcoming and have always made me feel at home. The hotel restaurant serves a good breakfast and a reasonable dinner. There are also some very good restaurants a short walk away from the hotel. The hotel is right next to the Bombay Hospital. Also several cinemas within walking distance. Not far from Churchgate and Marine Lines train stations. Wifi is available in the rooms but, unfortunately, it is not free.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: As much as possible, will not recommend this hotel
text:
First, I stayed here for four nights for a meeting. This hotel was chosen by the local organizer of the meeting I am attending.
I'm thinking of a good way to describe this hotel before stating my reasons for rating it as a poor hotel, but I only got two positive comments about this hotel. The food is good and the hotel staff are accommodating. The negative sides would be: (1) hotel is a bit expensive though it doesn't offer the same comfort as the price you paid; (2) pictures shown in their website are photos of what it looked like when it was new (I think so) but now it's really old, you can tell from the old-school elevator and unchanged carpet, my friend was even bitten by a bug the first night she stayed in here; (3) I don't know how they clean the hotel room, but you can tell that they are not cleaning it well because when I lifted the bed sheets, there are stills dusts and dirt which they didn't bother to clean, I got really itchy sometimes (4) WiFi is expensive! this was the main problem actually, you have to buy WiFi which costs over one dollar for only half an hour and five to six dollars for seven or eight hours of WiFi access consumable for 24 hours (while other hotel will offer it to you for free) (5) Does not have enough amenities, no kettle as I would usually eat cup noodles if I get lazy to grab some dinner outside since we don't have dinner inside the hotel, and also as soon as I heard that my friend was bitten by a bug I asked for a pair of slippers but they said that they do not have that kind of amenities (6) I think I already mentioned that the hotel is old-school, but aside from that you will most likely experience getting pissed off opening the door using your key 
I totally laughed when I saw 4-5 ratings of this hotel, I don't why but I hope they are totally legit. But to others who are thinking of staying at this hotel, think again my friend!
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking time out to review your recent stay at West End. It is through feedback such as yours that we are able to maintain and improve the services that we provide to our valued guests for more than 60 years.

1)  Your accommodation was booked by your local organizers who had been having similar conferences for last 04 years. It is a negotiated good tariff since the organizers are coming to us for last 04 years. So we have charged you a special low tariff.

2) We note that you are unhappy with the housekeeping & the housekeeping team will make greater efforts in future. Perhaps an instant feedback to room service or reception during your stay could have solved the issue. 

3) You feel that other hotels give WIFI free, we have studied the hotels in south Mumbai. Some give WIFI free(Included in the tariff, nothing is free in the world) & others charge if used. If you share your email ID with us we can email you WIFi charges of most hotels in South Mumbai

4) On each floor we have butler service & he can take any orders you give, even if it is just some hot water. We thank you for appreciating our food quality & saying that our staff are very accommodating.

5) We are an old hotel built in 1948 & we try our best to maintain it like a heritage hotel. The lifts are old but they are very functional & at all times manned with a liftman. Our ratings as per Tripadvisor is 3 n half stars.

If you and your friends stay with us, we will make every effort to see that your stay is happy stay.

Best Regards,

          Arjun Ramani
        General Manager
   West End Hotel, Mumbai
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good Location and value for money
text:
Airport Transfer
The hotel had provided us with a complimentary airport transfer which took about 30 munities because it was late evening.
The Check-in and Room
Our check in was extremely efficient and very quick. Whist the room was basic it was clean, spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was also clean, compact and the shower was hot. The free Wi-Fi in the room and the hotel was very good.
Location
The hotel is located near Dadar station and is surrounded by huge number of shops and restaurants. There are plenty of taxis in the area and the western rail can take you straight into the city.
Food and Restaurant
The restaurant offer an excellent choice for the vegetarians. There was good choice of local fruits and food at breakfast time. The restaurant staff were very friendly.
Pool and Gym
The hotel’s small pool was closed and did not seem inviting. The dingy gym had 2 treadmills. 

The staff everywhere were very friendly. The service we received was impeccable. We shall definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family members.
ownerResponse/text:

title: Our visit to Mumbai
text: It’s our 3rd stay in this hotel. Location is just great. Hotel is very clean and rooms are really nice. The staff here are absolutely nice always friendly helpful and ready to assist you in need. We recommend it very much. Breakfast is good they have Indian food, western too for people who can’t have this in the morning, you can order eggs anyway you like also dosa which comes hot and crispy with vegetables or just dosa which is very tasty. Rooms have nice hot water with amenities. They keep you water bottles in the rooms. The staff on the reception always smiling I do remember nikhil but all are nice. Next time we come we’ll surely stay here.
ownerResponse/text:

title: 3rd Stay....!!! The Best in Dadar !!! Mighty thanks to all staff.
text:
Hello to all readers and to all staff @ Trip !
I stayed at Ramee Guestline Dadar twice in a span of 10 days. 
First stay - 30th Nov to 3rd Dec- Suite room 202 ( I hope this the correct room number), 
Second stay - 8th Dec to 10th Dec 2019 - Suite room 102. Both my stay experiences were perfect. I was well looked after by all the staff. That is best part. They took care of all my possible needs. Both suite rooms were very comfortable. I have reviewed this hotel twice before and the quality of rooms / staff service is still maintained at the top. All amenities are in the room . The breakfast was a decent spread with a live cooking station. I was eating out most of the times and went light on the brekkie. I had a late night meal in the restaurant twice with friends and the non-vegetarian food was very very good. We had goat curry , seer fish fry and rotis. Everything was cooked very well with adequate spice level. I usually stay in Dadar for most purposes.....friends , food , local travel, shopping etc . This is where I will stay...
.... always !!
Once again, a big thanks to all staff - transport , concierge , front desk reception , restaurant staff , bar staff , room service staff, room cleaning staff and security staff. A big thanks to Saheeli , Aziz , Kamal , Sohail , Frank , Bala , Nikhil , Sagar and to everyone whose names I have missed to mention. I will return . Pics attached.

title: A hotel which felt more like home
text: Stayed at this hotel for a good 5 nights in 2 different rooms.  Attended a conference at Tata memorial. The room we had booked was full and being only 2 girls we were upgraded to the suite. The room was spacious and comfortable. 2 nights later my husband joined me and we moved into the double room. This room was also very spacious. Despite looking all run down from the outside the interior was very well maintained. The room service menu was extensive. If theres one dish to try you should definitely try the lamb shank pulao. We kept coming back for this despite moving hotels. The staff were all so friendly. Ever ready to help us. Giving us suggestions for shopping and places to visit. Everyone had such big smiles it was so hard to say goodbye. We didnt feel like we were strangers. The only downside about staying in this hotel is the fact that its right next to a heavy traffic flow. You can keep hearing honking through the night and day. It never stops. We stayed on the first floor in the suite. The honks were very loud but still manageable. Thereafter we moved to the 4th floor. The honks were very faint. So I'd suggest to ask for a high floor during check in. Definitely coming back. Good job team ramee

title: Back again ...2nd visit..The best in Dadar , for sure !!!
text:
Season's greetings to everyone and to all staff@Trip.
I stayed here on 17th Dec with late check out next day. I reserved the room at the hotel website directly. The hotel website quoted cheaper than the cost advertised on online travel engines. I also requested for airport pickup . My flight was 2 hours late and I called the hotel front desk to make them aware. The hotel cab person  called me as soon as my flight landed. He asked me to arrive at a pick up point. It took a while for him to get to me, but he got there eventually. Waiting time was approx 25 mins. From there , he drove through traffic , a lot of short cuts and I reached the hotel in 35-40 mins. So well done to him. I was happy to see familiar faces at the front desk and check was super smooth. I was given room 306 on the third floor. A big clean room with everything and anything. You name it and its there !. A medium sized toilet with shower in a tub. The room was quiet, bed was comfy and AirCon was brilliant. It was around 27 degs daytime in Mumbai. I had to meet a couple of people and the ease of transport around the hotel...its excellent. Every provision...ATM / medics / banks/ stores / restros / tuk tuk / taxis ....etc all within 10 min walking distance. The hotel is close to Siddhivinayak Temple ...20 min by taxi. This is the main reason I stay here. No banging disco's...no noise...Good food, good bed and so good sleep. I requested dinner as room service...Goat curry / rotis / salad..!! perfectly spiced and cooked. The second time....I had a great stay here. The staff here are jovial , professional & hardworking .....no doubt ! I was well taken care of. I requested late check out next day. I paid extra and was given a free airport drop in the afternoon. Thanks to all staff and front desk ..!! I will return. My stay cost with food/drinks was approx £110.
If in Dadar east .....It has to be Ramee !! The best there is !!

title: Гостиница европейского образца
text:
Великолепная европейская гостиница со всеми удобствами! Просторные чистые номера. Стабильный WiFi. Высококвалифицированный персонал в униформе, который не выпрашивает чаевые. Ответственная уборка каждый день. Завтрак на любой вкус.  Идеальное расположение, как для перемещений на такси, так и на метро, до которого идти пешком 1-2 минуты. В шаговой доступности есть торговые улицы со всеми необходимыми туристу магазинами, которые работают даже поздно вечером и ночью.  Приятным бонусом был бесплатный трансфер до аэропорта. С удовольствием бы вернулся в эту гостиницу.
PS.: На карте может показаться, что гостинца находится около ЖД-вокзала, но по факту это закрытые пути метрополитена, которые можно пройти удобным надземным переходом.

title: Wifi 500 rs. Charge for 1 day
text:
Visited the property again after around 3 years. It seems the management is only concentrating on money profit & no guest satisfaction.

The staff is still very good, helpful & courteous specially in dining area & pool area.

But things are not so good inside the hotel, in room food menu the minimum costing dish is bread butter jam & that is 350 rs., Now that is too much for simple jam bread. Though i have seen rates even more but if you are taking rates of 5 star then why are your things are so poor, like jacuzzi not working, bath tub was having stains, breakfast buffet spread was very small.

Wifi charges are 500 rs for 24 hours. Not sure whether they invented 6G or something, due to which they are charging so much... 

Inside in the club if you want to play air hockey you need to pay 150 rs. for 15 minutes, the pool/billiards is chargeable even for the guest who have already paid for the stay. In Spa for ladies guest no massage facility available.

Also on reception, even late check-out was denied & was told we are sold out. Come-on man on Monday morning who gets sold out. In buffet breakfast there was not a single guest, then how can you get sold out, seems you have received the maximum profit & minimum guest satisfaction from your higher ups.

Will never visit this resort again....
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ms.Khan,

Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your stay at The Retreat Hotel & Convention Centre Mumbai.

I appreciate your constructive comments and rest assured, the gaps highlighted through your feedback have been carefully noted. We are most concerned with the satisfaction of all our guests and your feedback is of great value to us. It allows us to ensure and improve the quality of service we want to offer our discerning guests.

At the Retreat Hotel & Convention Centre, Mumbai we ensure that our product and services continue to meet the highest standards to make your stay more comfortable. However, in your case it seems we were unable to satisfy your expectations.

I apologize for the inconvenience caused and would request you to give us an opportunity to serve you better on your next visit.

Look forward to receiving you at The Retreat Hotel & Convention Centre, Mumbai.

With Regards,

Cons:
1. Due to on going renovations pool and spa is shut.. which was a big bummer.
2. Room locks are problematic. They had to call a service guy to fix our lock. But eventually had to shift our room. Same happened with some other guests as well. 
3. The beach attached is not at all clean. Laden with grease & plastic.
4. View from rooms isn’t all that great. Definitely not worth spending 5-6k for pool view room. 
5. Food is ridiculously expensive. 2 filter coffees costed us 540 rs and the milk was of bad quality. Although food tastes good - it isn’t worth the cost. 

Pro tip - Don’t fall for room categories such as delux room/ executive room/ etc - they are all identical. Just costlier ones are on higher floor but it doesn’t make sense since the view isn’t that great anyway.

title: Not worth the money
text:
Stayed here for a company stay, for a week. My impressions of the place:
1. Room - I was given a single room which, for the money being charged, was quite pathetic (Rs. 4500 + taxes). I actually measured the size of the room, it was barely 15 ft x 8 ft, excluding washroom. The room is small hence the air coming from the AC vents hits you directly on your head and i woke on both mornings with a bad headache. Decided to keep the AC switched off. The washroom is also so small that if unless you close the door, you can't access the washbasin. The furniture in the rooms is old fashioned, not to my taste. There is a thin slab given in place of a working table, wasn't very convenient. The only upside was that upon my request, they upgraded me to the "Club Room" which was a major major improvement. Nicely done room, with proper table for keeping your laptop. The washroom in this one was much better, with a bath tub. If this was the room given at the first instance, it would have been a different experience.
2. Location: Right next to Dadar East Station, quite in the centre of city. Full marks for that.
3. Food: I only had breakfast here and while the spread was manageable (should have been wider though), I wasn't very impressed with the quality of food (eggs were super hard boiled, wheat flakes were moist, cold milk wasn't cold enough) and the flavours were ordinary. Never had dinner given the exorbitant prices, almost comparable to a 4/5 star property and I was never impressed with food in mornings, so did not have the confidence.
4. Amenities: They have a fitness centre which is nothing more than few machines kept in corridors. You can't even stretch your hand there, and its stuffy in there. But at least they had a fitness centre. They also have a swimming pool, which i never checked out. So cannot comment. They do not seem to have satellite TV (in today's age!) and the cable does not have very user friendly menu. Half the channels don't even come. 
5. Service: The staff was courteous and always more than willing to help. Always cheerful and greeted me everytime they saw me. They have been trained very well, I must say.
placeInfo/address: Opp. Swami Narayan Temple Dadar (E), Mumbai, Mumbai 400014 India
