title: Sound proof....Covenient...and Cosy..!!!!!
text:
Hello to all readers and to all Staff @ Trip.
I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights starting 24th May 2018, during my brief journey to India. This is my review. 
This is the only hotel where I booked a room directly on the hotel website. The cost was slightly cheaper than what various travel engines advertised. I received an instant confirmation with a reservation number ( credit / debit card required to secure this) with a notice to pay all monies at checkout. The hotel offered a complimentary airport pick up from both airports and I emailed them a wrong arrival time. This was picked up by Dadar Sales team @ Ramee and they got back to me ASAP. Very thoughtful of them. I informed them of my correct arrival time and all was sorted. Only one way transfer is complimentary. I was picked up by a polite hotel cab driver and the journey took 30 mins to reach hotel from domestic airport , during peak traffic. The check in was smooth and I was offered an upgrade to master bedroom ....Room 104. Thanks to reception staff for that. The first thing I noticed inside the hotel was quietness and calm. This hotel is next to a very busy road leading to Dadar rail station( next to hotel) . This is a very busy noisy chaotic area with a high level of noise pollution. Inside the hotel......inside the room......everything was calm. Excellent. My guest room was large and sufficient for me. The bed was good, soft and clean linen. AC worked fantastic......Polar temperature  throughout... Mumbai was hot and humid ( 37 to 38 deg celsius + around 55% humidity)......serious discomfort and dehydration if you are out and about. The room had all 5 star amenities. Kettle , locker , cabinet, mini bar and nice medium sized bathroom. The only non-5 star item was a standard def TV. The bathroom was well stocked and the towels were soft / good/clean. Medium sized mirror and a working hair dryer. This hotel is in a suburb in the middle of the city. And it was very convenient for me to travel anywhere I wanted. I used app based taxi services to go from A to B. During my stay ...there were no corporate parties / weddings / functions etc.......so it was very quiet in the night. Perfect for a good sleep. I ate out at few places which I will review later. The complimentary buffet breakfast was standard and just adequate. Not a lot of spread but how much can a person eat at 9 am in the morning ? The hotel staff , reception staff and room service staff, security staff, restaurant staff....everyone .......all were polite ,courteous and professional. I had ordered room service dinner on one of the nights and it was very good. Well prepared spicy goat meat curry with rotis, lentils and salad. Delicious and good. The hotel has a small gym on the top floor and a medium sized pool. I did not use them but the pool was clean and maintained . There was a gym staff member who showed me around. Thanks fella ! The hotel has an in-house restaurant and bar, that is open till late. This hotel is located in such a place.....that whatever you need......provisions, medicines , snacks , ATM , Clinic, transport etc ....everything is 5 mins walk. Over all , I had a fabulous stay. I used to stay at Ramee Juhu, but during previous 2 times ....I could not sleep because of club music banging through the walls. So I chose to stay in Ramee Dadar and I am happy that I made this decision. I am returning to hotel for another stay in December 2018. A big thanks to everyone @ Ramee Dadar. Thumbs Up...!!!!!!
Pics attached.

title: Beachfront, Serene Ambience but lacks in Value for Money they charge
text:
This was a small family vacation. The Hotel is located close to Mumbai and offers beach front with serene atmosphere and large outdoor space for perfect relaxation and comfort. With all these good, Property is old, seriously needs refurbishments especially in rooms and other facilities it offers. Most facilities offered free or in the room packages are charged (Wifi/ Room Sleepers etc.) You have to pay for Lunch/ Dinner right at the restaurant, not with final settlement (unlike other star hotels).
Last but not the least, staff is really polite and helpful, holding fort amongst these few irritants. But worth a stay if price offers manages small nick nacks.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr.Sanil,

Thank you for selecting The Retreat Hotel & Convention Centre, Mumbai as your accommodation choice in Mumbai.

We understand that during your short family vacation you had a mixed experience about the stay.

Regarding the room maintenance, you would be happy to learn that we re-enforced the on-going maintenance program of our guest rooms.

With regards to complimentary Wi-Fi  / Room Slipper’s we do charge minimum rate since that is our hotel's policy however we have put in your valuable feedback.

Last but not the least thank you for appreciating our staff who are the gems of the hotel.

We thank you for your feedback, as that helps us to refine our services further and we look forward to welcoming you again soon at The Retreat, the preferred leisure destination in Mumbai!

With Regards

The Retreat Hotel and Convention Centre .

title: Beachfront, however, not worth it
text:
The place is situated right next to the beach , the reason why we decided to book our stay here. However, since the locality is inhabited by fishermen, you can smell fish, prawns etc in the hotel too, which kind of makes the experience little sour. Also, you can't visit beach because of the smell and the fishermen put all their daily catch just behind the hotel , so you have to literally cross the entire lot to reach beach. 

Rooms are decent and budget friendly. Staff is polite and nice too. Though guests do not follows any kind of Covid related protocol inside the hotel . And hotel staff also doesn't bother much about it. 

Breakfast option is very limited and you might want to carry some snacks with you for untimely hunger !

title: Amazing hotel, pathetic service they do not mention hidden cost that amount to 15% extra per day.

title: A very Good Place which can be Excellent
text:
I was looking for a single day option to stay in Mumbai with my wife and daughter and came across The Retreat Hotel & Convention Centre. The pictures looked good, and the place is as equally good. 

Pros
- Rooms are good, clean
- Pool is superb
- Beautiful Place, access to the beach which is pretty clean
- Staff is good, smiling, special mention of Mr Rakesh, he greets you every time he meets you.

Cons (not really cons but these are points which can be definitely improvised upon)
- Breakfast (limited options, especially for non vegetarian)
- Pool Water Temperature (it's cold throughout the year, when I visited it was cold weather, and with the cool water, I could spend very less time in the pool)

Overall it is a great place for a weekend gate away.

Tips
- Choose the pool facing rooms, and preferred on the 3rd floor or above.
- Opt for breakfast and meal (at least Lunch or Dinner). Since the resort is far from the market, it will be a good to opt for meal.
- Book in advance, you may end up with a good deal.
placeInfo/address: Madh Island Marve Road Malad West, Mumbai 400061 India

title: Average
text:
Whilst visiting Mumbai we choose “The Retreat “as a place for us friends to hang out and spend a night . This was our first visit and so were NOT aware of the overpowering fish smell which is all around the hotel and outdoor pool area. Avoid this place if you are vegetarian as the smell is unbearable .
The staff were polite , however service was extremely slow in all areas from getting drinks to the pool area to the final bill .
Breakfast buffet was ok , cold on occasions . 
There is charge of 500 Rupees for 24 hours WiFi , WiFi did not work at all in our room after ringing multiple times and requesting reception to rectify there service the response was quite laid back . 
There is charge for almost everything so be prepared if you request something . We paid 50Rupees each for room slippers something most five star hotels provide for free anyways , one green tea costed at 140 Rupees . 
If you need room service for food you need to deposit 2000 Rupees at reception first.  
We were told at the reception that retreat had private gate to enter the beach area . To our horror when the security guard opened the gate... the place was filled with dead fish and crabs drying out in open air . There is no stairs or proper way to enter beach . 
We paid over 15000 rupees for one night for slow service and additional charges for almost everything else on top of it .
ownerResponse/text:
Dear 

We would like to thank you for choosing our hotel as your accommodation choice and for taking the time to post a review about your experience.

title: Good choice for a very comfortable and relaxed visit

Staff were friendly, courteous, helpful and efficient.   My booking was for the room only - there was no opportunity to try the restaurant this time but I hope to do so in the future.   Overall a very comfortable and enjoyable experience and I would certainly choose to stay here again.

Have stayed several times over several years and the West End does not disappoint - if anything, it gets better with time.  I know I'll be happy in Mumbai at the West End.

title: Great hotel, good care with sick child
text:
I chose this hotel based on reviews I read here and on another hotel booking site. I was impressed with the positive feedback, particularly in regards to cleanliness and quality of staff.  We have two young children and needed a good place in the heart of Mumbai we could be comfortable in for a few days. This hotel was a perfect place. Nice rooms, kept up nicely, very delicious food. Three days into our stay, our oldest daughter became very very sick. It was a scary experience,  but Hotel West End is right next to Mumbai Hospital!  I did not know this when I booked here, but how wonderful to get good care in an urgent situation. So that is a plus.  Also, the staff here was very gracious and honored our every request for help, clean linens, fresh beverages and answering questions so we could get the help we needed for our child.   We had to extend our stay, and they allowed us extra night with no questions asked.  We had the "family room" and it was so comfortable with a sitting area and nice bed and couch. Many of our family members in Mumbai came to see us here while our child was sick and the hotel never had a problem with visitors to our room. 

I would recommend this place to anyone anyone who wants a lovely place to stay in Mumbai. It is a great hotel.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you very much for taking time out to write a heart touching review. Your comments on our services & staff are highly appreciated. We will be honored if you stay with us in future again. Wish you & your family a happy & healthy new year.

Yours Faithfully,

              Arjun Ramani
           General Manager
      West End Hotel, Mumbai
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: A nice old-fashioned hotel
text: Three of us stayed here for 2 nights on a recent, first, family visit to Mumbai.  We deliberately chose this hotel because of its location.  The taxi driver from the airport had difficulty finding the street and hotel so if you are planning a visit, make sure that you have a good location map.  The hotel itself sits on a rather dirty and busy street, typical of our expectations of this city.  It is only a short taxi ride from the Gateway of India or Marine Drive and a couple of friendly taxi drivers wait outside ready, it would seem, to take you anywhere. Inside the hotel is very clean, dated with a welcoming and helpful staff. The lifts struggle with more than a couple of people. The rooms are large and bright with firm beds and dated air conditioners that try hard to keep the temperature at a reasonable level.  The food in the restaurant is very good with a wide choice and very attentive service. We'd definitely stay there again.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Life-Threatening Experience at Era by Orchid, Mumbai Terminal 2 – Room Ceiling Collapsed!
text:
Life-Threatening Experience at Era by Orchid, Mumbai Terminal 2 – Room Ceiling Collapsed!

I had a deeply distressing and life-threatening experience during my recent stay at Era by Orchid, Mumbai Terminal 2.

I checked into the hotel around 8:30 AM and was given early check-in by 10:00 AM. After freshening up, I left for some personal work and returned to my room (Room No. 218) at approximately 6:45 PM. While having dinner in the room, I noticed a strange, unpleasant smell. I assumed it was due to the ongoing rain and didn’t think much of it.

Moments later, to my absolute shock, a stone suddenly fell inside the room. I stood up in confusion, trying to understand where it came from — and within seconds, the entire ceiling of the room collapsed right in front of me. It was terrifying. My phone and luggage were buried under the debris. I was in a complete state of panic and barely managed to escape being injured — or worse.

I immediately called the hotel reception and informed them of the emergency. Shockingly, it took nearly 10 minutes for a single cleaning staff member to arrive, and only after more time passed did the rest of the hotel team show up. Rather than treating the situation with urgency, the hotel staff tried to downplay the incident. They offered to upgrade my room and began persuading me to accept a voucher for a future stay as a form of apology.

The hotel managers kept trying to convince me not to escalate the matter or leave a review, promising that they would “compensate” me. But this was not a minor inconvenience — this was a serious safety hazard that could have cost me my life. I was unable to sleep all night due to the trauma. I checked out early the next morning around 6:45 AM to catch my flight, still in shock from the previous night’s events.

I’m writing this not out of anger, but out of responsibility — so that no one else has to face such a terrifying and unsafe experience. A hotel has a basic duty to ensure the structural safety of its rooms. This was a failure of the highest order.

Please think twice before booking this property.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ms. Megha,
Namaskar!

First and foremost, please accept our heartfelt apologies for the unfortunate incident that occurred during your recent stay at Ira by Orchid, Mumbai. We fully understand the discomfort and distress this must have caused you, and we deeply regret that your experience did not reflect the standards of safety, service, and comfort we strive to maintain.

We would like to humbly clarify that such an occurrence is extremely rare and unprecedented in our hotel’s history. It was as unexpected and concerning for us as it was for you. Please be assured that we conduct regular inspections and follow strict preventive maintenance protocols throughout the property. On the day of the incident, the hotel was nearly at full occupancy, and no such concerns were reported from any other room or section underscoring that this was an isolated, unforeseen event.

Due to monsoon-related dampness, a small portion of the ceiling gave way unexpectedly. Our team responded immediately by shifting you to a suite room, as ensuring the comfort, safety, and well-being of our guests is not just our priority,it is our responsibility.

With reference to your mention of our team trying to persuade you, we would like to clarify with due respect that there was no intention to force or influence your decision regarding sharing a review. We sincerely respect your right to express your experience, and any communication from our side was merely to share our concern and reaffirm that this situation does not reflect our usual standards.

The compensation offered was a sincere gesture of goodwill and not as a substitute for your experience,but as a token of our genuine regret for the inconvenience you encountered.

Once again, we extend our deepest apologies and appreciate you for bringing this matter to our attention. Your feedback plays a vital role in helping us maintain and continuously enhance the standards of service and care we strive to offer all our guests.

Thanks & Regards 
Rajesh Mehta 
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Kurla Rd Near Chakala, Mumbai 400059 India
placeInfo/name: IRA By Orchid Mumbai T2 International Airport

title: Great resort, but a little over-rated
text:
We were at The Retreat last tow days for our anniversary celebration. We loved staying here. However, here are some great and not-so-great points :

GREAT :

Service : The staff here is very attentive and courteos
Cleanliness : Rooms and premises are very clean and very nicely maintained.
Huge pool : The pool is huge, we stayed in the pool-view room and it was superb

NOT so great :

1. We paid about 17000 for 2 nights with breakfast. However, the hotel charging such tariff [claiming a 5-star rating] charges 500 rupees per day for Wi-Fi

2. The restaurant menu is limited. Also, when we ordered for Pizza, they said that Pizza was not available. This is not expected of a 5-star rating hotel.

3. They have 2 restaurants - Tangerine and Oriental bowl. Liquor is served only in Oriental Bowl restaurant that serves Chinese. So, if you want to have liquor with your food, you HAVE TO EAT chinese and CANT EAT any other cuisine.

Otherwise, this hotel is great to stay for Mumbaikars too

title: Inconsistent - poor on communication
text:
Overall stay was good. But its full of inconstancies
- Checkin was smooth, rooms are decent size, cooling is good, offers perfect sea view. While there are strong smells in the corridor. Toiletries are basic. Room service requires follow ups
- The swimming pool is big, and well attended. But in sorry state. Broken tiles, algea in places, bird feathers floating. The floating restaurant is not appealing at all.
-  Club house is good, steam bath and jacuzzi is clean and functional too. Attendant Nitin was helpful
- Dinner spread is limited with no starters on the weekdays and only 2 starters on the weekends. Desserts are good. 

Based on previous reviews, at the time of check-in we asked about the movie screening and activities for children. They said it was only for Diwali. On the very next day they arranged the programs and there was no communication. My daughter was disheartened  because she could not attend anything. We were disappointed. Mr Kashinath, the manager was only saying yes mam and wasn't apologetic at all. We raised concerns about the buffet spread as well. Mr Felix and Mr Vincent managers at the restaunt made it up to us by their excellent service. Also offered a nice fried fish. 

Not sure if we will visit again. But those who are planning to visit, do not expect 5 star hospitality. Facilities and property location can be enjoyed thoroughly. Choose breakfast plan only. There is a restaurant nearby (rated 3.7 stars on zomato) which delivers food at the hotel.
ownerResponse/text:

have a club with some indoor games and a gym

very peaceful place 

hotel interior is old style but very well maintained

title: Spare yourself and your money, don't go to this hotel
text:
Pros:
1. Breakfast
2. Swimming pool
3. Beach entry (the beach is filled with plastic though)
4. Some of the stuff are courteous

Cons:
1. Rude receptionists who are asking for money while checking in even when the pre-booking has been done
2. Very poor quality of food which is served from their restaurant (and the price is toooo high.)
3. Even after complaining about the food quality, they made same mistakes again and again. I guess they dont have many good chefs.
4. Dirty bed sheet and pillow covers. White pillow covers have become brownish yellow in colour
5. This is the first hotel who says "wifi is not a part of your package". One of its kind.
6. Every complaint gets followed by an empty promise that "someone senior will talk to you". This promise mostly remains unfulfilled.
7. Finally, they claim that they are 5 star hotel. Google says that it's a 3 star one. Frankly, I have stayed in far far far better 3 star hotels. In fact, star system cannnot be applied to this hotel.

title: Comfortable stay but militarised hotel
text:
i stayed in the month of feb. The morning & evenings felt slight cold n daytime was hot. rooms are cozy and comfortable. Interiors are usual . Smoking isn't allowed in rooms . as such there are no smoking rooms in hotel . Bathroom has bathing tub and poor amenities. Only Soap, shampoo, Body moisturiser. basic amenities like Conditioner, toothpaste , Bathing gel not available. Pool view rooms and sea view rooms are on same side . from lower floors you might not be able to view sea . my room on 5th floor was a sea view. Other side namely palm view has Lush green Palm view with city in background. food spread at buffet breakfast was nominal. food was at times not cooked properly all the fried dishes were too oily . taste was compromised in all dishes. dinner was okay north indian food taste was bad . on the contrary cream of mushroom soup n continental sizzlers  were superb at taste and are must try . I wasn't very happy with reception as almost every query was left unanswered to call back. my first query asked for a match box they denied and said no smoking allowed than they said if you have your matchbox you can smoke but we wont provide. 
next query can I bring my drink down on poolside and smoke again no you are not allowed to take your own drinks. Leisure travellers avoid as check out time is 10 am which is too early. after making many hard request I was given an extension of 2 hours when there hotel was 80 percent vacant.
I wanted to go over seaside but the gate wont open after 630 at times it seemd I m living in a military hotel. I am responsible for my own good why hotel should be concerned or decide when can I go n not . and hotel should provide facility for guests to come n go anytime they like after all we came here for chilling not for doing drill as per hotel rules. if you were supposed to read rules of getting into swimming pool you will feel another military statement ; overall not a guest friendly feel.

title: I wouldn’t give it one - beware!
text:
I was one of the guest invited to a destination wedding.  Appearance can be so deceiving. First of all, the website needs to be updated: get rid of 4/5 star hotel - it doesn’t measure up to it.  Beware, this place is isolated, first part of the Mumbai drive was ok, after all we were in India.   As we left for the outskirts, we were stuck in traffic for almost 40mins (one lane each way) and with no systematic driving, it was a mess.  First impression of the hotel was really nice until we got out of the car - boy that fishy smell hits you hard.  
We got greeted by a young man who held the door for us and went through security for bag check.  Great to know that the valued their guest safety.  Then we got greeted by another young person who was handing out some green and orange drinks which I decided not to try and headed for the front desk to get checked in.  There were 4 persons working and not one person gave us any eye contact or acknowledged.  One was checking in another guest, one was on the phone and other two were discussing something looking at the computer.  While I waited I looked at the lobby which was clean and modern updated furniture.  Still some hope. After waiting for 15 mins or so we got checked in.  I forgot about my frustration.  The checking in was smooth and quick, however, there was no mention to where the breakfast going to be, no mention of operating times, what was included and no mention about the internet.  We were informed to the elevators and that was it.   
In the elevator, there were photos (old prints) of Conrad hotel and couple of other brands that this management company manages and on the other side: had photos of the facilities (massage, Sauna &  game room) and activities had to offer (again old prints) proudly hang up.  There was some hope.  As we made our way to our room, you could literally see peeled paint, wauppet walls and flirty corridor carpets.  I couldn’t wait to see our room.  I was pleased with view; could just about see the ocean, pool and green grounds.  We were on the third floor.  To my surprise, the room and bathroom looked clean, so I thought.  I couldn’t be more wrong, the bathroom stung like smelly dirty rags, it was the shower curtain.  One thing I have to mention is that the housekeeping staff were great and prompt.  As soon as I made a call for housekeeping, they immediately came and fixed the issues.  Internet was a big issue; there were 3 persons in our room and internet service is only issued to 2 persons per room.  This was a big issue.  There was a charge for internet but because of the group block it was complimentary.  
I could go on and write down more issues but then I would be writing a book.   I will advice you on few more important issues; the property is so run down. The hallways sink of mildew/mold; there is so much of dampness in the air that the wall paint was peeling off, the carpet has probably never been vacuumed.  I saw a housekeeper sweeping the hallway carpet with sticks tied together to form a broom.  The bedsheets felt damp at night.   When I went to inquiry on the cost of massage and the location of the spa at the front desk, they had no clue but directed me to the spa.  When I got there, I was told that they had massage service available only for men and not women.  Very shocking.  The sauna was closed down and had not be in use for several months, the staff informed me.  
Question would be why not just move - couldn’t!   All the weddings events were mainly in the evening and it is very difficult to find transportation after 5pm.  Even if they agreed to take you, they would triple the rate.  One last note; what is up with a generic reply to guest’s review.   This management company has a lot to answer for and as for the owners of this place - this place could be a gem but it needs a lot of attention.

title: Five star? Sorry, not even close
text:
Staying here for a week as part of a family wedding group reminded me of all the reasons I have pretty much abandoned big hotels in recent years and always look for a boutique experience or a private apartment.
The complex looks great from the outside (perhaps it was the relief on arriving in one piece after a marathon and hair-raising trip from central Mumbai) but on closer inspection it's easy to see the cracks - missing (cosmetic) tiles on the roof, damp-affected corridors (and rooms - the lower the floor you are on, and if you're not facing the pool side, the worse the problem seems to be and if you don't want to run air con non stop you will certainly notice it at this time of year) and very patchy service added up to a frustrating experience.
Staff are very willing but often clueless - they'll agree to do something and then forget, or get the wrong end of the stick, particularly at mealtimes, and are available in such numbers that their inability to run slick services is even more irritating.
Fittings are often wobbly, whether that's restaurant tables or electrical sockets, housekeeping and room service can proceed at a snail's pace, booking in and checking out takes an age with plenty of paperwork and stapling, and I needed reception (or twice the IT team) to reset the wi-fi at least once a day during my stay.
Food is pretty good, with lots of Indian options on the buffet which don't look that appealing but taste fine, and if you want to stay Western there's enough to keep you fed. The specialist Oriental restaurant which doubles as the bar is also work checking out.
The pool is a very appealing prospect with plenty of shade, but it also appeals to egrets and crows in great number and one member of staff with a clapperboard acts as a human scarecrow when they flock in at peak times. The grounds generally are peaceful and pleasant and there are a couple of secluded hammocks which are well worth seeking out.
The complex is right on the coast and you can walk out of the back gate (security permitting) for a stroll along the beach but while the sunset is striking you also have to put up with the stink of drying fish (a local industry) and plenty of rubbish.
The five star rating would not hold water in the UK, but to be fair the prices were very attractive to a Western purse. Won't be back, though.

title: very welcoming and helpful hotel, good location
text:
The room was nice and big, A.C. and the fans worked well, the room was cleaned satisfactorily every day. 
The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, assisting with luggage and any extras for the room.
The laundry service was quick and to a good standard.
Very good location.
The only thing that could have been better is the wifi price, which was very expensive a £1.50 an hour.
It is next door to a Sufi shrine and to Bombay hospital so it can get quite crowded outside, and there are a few beggars who are visiting either place.
Interesting fact: this hotel is famous for defying prohibition in the 1950s, and still has a nice bar,

I could not comprehend her as the booking was shown as confirmed from 17th to 19th of Oct.(Print Out) .According to her CODE AND DECODE "We cant accept you if the transaction is not done"- Talk to your agent !

Seriously it beats me! What transaction ,when i had already done the booking and Paid for the rooms as stated by Agoda a week plus before checking in.booking code  229712037.

According to Ms Needa i had to call my agent Agoda myself and speak to them ,clarify the glitches of Charges or payments then only then we will be allowed to check in only if they received the payment.

I did ask her what payments was she talking about .She was INDEED VERY RUDELY REPLYING From the begining since we had stepped in the hotel as if she owns the hotel and it seems we are some crap people checking in the hotel.It was indeed a humiliation as if we could not afford to stay in that hotel.

We had done all our hotels booking in Kolkatta,Shirdi the  same way as in Mumbai-Mumbai was the only exclusive one with such an issue and such a "Great and Polite Staff" like Ms Needa!

I had no choice but to call Agoda in Singapore to reconfrim my status of the hotel booking and there i was told that the hotel booking was confirmed and there were no other information that i should be aware of.

I was using my India prepaid sim to call Sin as my Sin Hp was locked hence inoperative.I did inform them (the staff) that my credit was low despite that  they took my hp in their office to talk to the customer representive from Agoda.

This really puzzled me- If there was a difference in the pricing then they should update in advance not on the day when a customer checks in .As we had paid as per mentioned by Agoda.

And to take my Hp in the office to talk was another blow.The best thing when i received my hp there was no balance left - Amazing Staff- Not even the courtsey to say that the balance was all used up while in conversation with Agoda in Sin.Simply the hp was  handed over to me and the staff told us to wait till they figured out the whole issue of payments.They kept blaming the Agent-Agoda. Isnt this the internal finance matter.

Nevertheless i  paitently waited along with,My wife and my niece.Meanwhile there was this gentlemen who came in with really polite mannerisim and the way he had handled the whole situation was indeed.He was Mr Frank the GM.

He had taken over the whole issue and had explained in such an professional way.While Mr Frank was in conversation with my wife ,Ms Needa had moved out towards the lobby - while doing so she had made faces on us to her staff who stood out and this was noticed by myself personally. 

We urge if you do have a CCTV Please have a look on us checking in and how Ms Needa had behaved during the whole duration! Timing approximately in between 1610hrs to  1725 hrs india time.

No doubt Mr Frank had handled the situation beautifully and sincereThanks to him but on the contray your own staff had ruined the reputation of the hotel .

Indeed a heartfelt dissapointment on this Mumbai trip. Mr Frank had apologised on her behalf and said she was briefed accordingly. Mr Frank had mentioned that she was sorry - 

You think so- Really she felt sorry for us ? Mr Frank was doing his job on the supervisory level.If Ms Needa was indeed sorry wouldnt she approach us and sincerly apologise for her rude behaviour.

This is not a personal clash ,i am just amazed with such a reputated Hotel having such Staff with so little or perhaps no ettiquite and i think people should know the reality of  the staff - who is indeed  passionate about their scope of job.

I too have been working in Service industry since past 20 years.Doesnt matter how nasty your guest are they are still your paymaster and one should not forget that when working in the service line.

Infact Ms Needa was rude to her own staff Mr Bala who was together with her at the reception when we came in .Amazing how do you allow your staff to bully not only the Guest but also your own internal staff.

I would appreciate if The HOD could look into this matter personally.

I am indeed upset internally.If not for my wife i would have left the hotel immediately where there is no respect or hospitality shown . It only comes in As SERVICE RECOVERY . IS THAT THE WAY ? ..

No  doubt service recovery was done  but did it actually help .I do not think so as your staff had made my memories with an unpleasantries.

Its our holiday but ..what had happened will surely be remembered and be an example of a Good Service Commumication Skills with your guest.

I hope to hear from your respective department .If there is anh further queries please do contact me at vjbatman61@gmail.com or darshanas@yahoo.com

Awaiting your kind reply .

Thanking you.

Warm regards

Runjit Singh.

text: The hotel is primarily for business professionals.  The restaurant is OK and the breakfast is relatively basic.  Expected more for the money charged.  Location wise it is in a very crowded area.  The taxi service provided by the hotel is very nice and the drivers are very professional and personable.  They get the highest marks.  The restaurant staff needs more motivation.  If they can clean the windows from the outside, the rooms will look better.

title: Brilliant
text:
Staff : All staff from security, bell boys, waiting, housekeeping, pool attendant and receptionists were friendly, caring and always welcoming. Special mention of Ashish, Needa, Robin and Bala as we associated with them more frequently at the front desk. They even convinced me to cancel my airport hotel booking later in the trip and put up at the Ramee offering complimentary transport to the airport.
Location: So strategic on the doorstep of Dadar station, in fact on our return from upcountry the coolie brought our luggage staring to the hotel. Ramee has a good Punjabi restaurant as well as good eateries within walking distance.
Breakfast : Included in the price, was a perfect start to the day. Egg counter and new items each day of indian breakfast, fresh juices and pastries. 
Pool : Well maintained and clean, just what you need after a day out in Mumbai. The attendant even taught my son how to swim underwater. 
Definitely, our preferred hotel for Mumbai and highly recommend to friends and relatives in London.
P.Parekh

title: Excellent service, Great staff
text: I've just come back from this wonderful country with the kindest people on earth ... India.  What a trip! And besides the beautiful country, the magical city of Mumbai and its superb people, another element which made my stay there a memorable one was the hotel where I stayed at, for 26 days. An excellent location, a centrally located hotel next to Dadar east train station, an area with cafes and restaurants around it.  A very clean hotel with great service and a 5 star hotel staff. They made my stay there an unforgettable one. They were always worried if I was fine and if I needed anything else besides all the perfect services they provided. I'd like to thank all the staff for their work and collaboration but especially 4 people who treated me like family. Mr. D. Frank, the duty manager who was always smiling and was there for me whenever I needed his help. Mrs. Needa & Mr. Robin two of the receptionists who were so friendly,  kind and helpful as well as the rest of the staff of course.  And last but not least the maitr of the restaurant who was always worried if my meals were satisfying which they were since food quality and service were simply excellent.  To all of you, thank you for making my stay there a comfortable one and for being so hospitable. Keep up the good work!!!

title: Great staff
text:
A nice hotel in a convenient location. Near the Dadar railway station. Easy to assess the city or north to Bandra. 
The staff are very friendly and always willing to help and a great asset to this hotel. 
Having access to a pool in Mumbai is good. Its on the roof top and opens in the morning and the afternoon. 
Hotel is clean and it has a good selection range for breakfast, Indian and western. 
Mumbai is one of the most expensive places to stay in india and Ramee is good valve for money. 
Cons- The wifi is terrible. Not always accessible in the rooms and always having to sign in is a constant pain. 
As seems usual in india the Ramee is missing a preventive maintenence program with sum repairs and upkeep lacking. 
The rooms don't have opening windows or exhaust and as such can become stuffy.
The restuarant food is expensive compared to outside outlets.

title: Good facilities
text:
This hotel is in Madh , which is approx 20 km from Mumbai airport. Though it is not very far from busy Mumbai city but once you reach there you will feel you have suddenly come to a peaceful and calm location. The property is quite big and is on the sea. The sea is just outside the hotel back gate, though it is not a proper beach where you can go for swim.
The rooms are spacious and if you get a poolside room on the higher floor you can get a majestic view of the Arabian sea. They have a huge pool for swimming. They have 2 restaurants and food though a bit expensive , is of good quality. The breakfast spread was also good. Definitely worth going there once.

title: A Day Well Spent !!!
text:
This was our 2nd visit to Retreat & it was awesome. 
We were allocated a pool facing room & the pool view was really beautiful. 
The room was good & spacious with bath tub, all their rooms have bathtub as informed during the booking time,
 
We started the day in the warm Jacuzzi next to the swimming pool, then we went to the swimming pool, the staff near the swimming pool was very helpful & very attentive.
We then went to the children's room in the club house, it is good with few swings, good for the kids. In clubhouse we played carom, table tennis & the board football games. We had the Lunch in the Tangerine Cafe, the manager in the restaurant was very nice. In evening we went for swimming & again to club house to play games & in night had buffet dinner in Tangerine Cafe, the dinner was good,
 
Everyone in the family had a great time, Will love to visit again soon.

All the staff are very helpful & efficient.

title: Fishy Conclave
text:
We had a reunion recently and therefore stayed there for 1 night/day. 

The first thing that hits a person as soon as you enter the property is the strong and overpowering stench of dried fish. Perhaps somewhere nearby the fishermen must be drying fish. The putrid smell of fish accompanies you everywhere to even the hotel floor corridors.

The property is old and this is quite evident. Peeling paint and wall paper adhesion deformity at several places. Step inside and one discovers large sized room which is a good point. But step inside the washroom and you find the mirrors that are stained and old.

Coming to food, we had a buffet spread for 2 days and frankly nothing there's nothing I can write about. The tikkas (chicken) that were being served while we had a cocktail dinner were just too spicy to digest.

The only plus this property has is the large sized pool though I can't comment as did not find the time to take a dive.

Simply put, quite a disappointing stay.

title: Strong Dry fish smell makes it average
text:
Its a mixed bag I would say based on my 2 nights stay in April,2018 !

Check in/Checkout and Billing (+)
Pool side Rooms  (+)
Cleanliness (+)
Toiletries (-)
Breakfast (+)
Dinner (-) (for the price charged, spread isn't that great)
Swimming pool and Jacuzzi (+)
Games room, Gym and Garden/Lawn (+)

However all the pluses gets nullified with major minus point is strong dry fish smell (as fishermen dry their fishes on beach which is on back side of the hotel). 
Though beach is just 50-100 steps away, one need strong will to fight fishy smell to reach the sand and sea.
Rooms if sprayed with air fresheners every few hours, it can suppress strong fishy smell a bit.

Overall I find it over rated and over priced !

title: Nice hotel away from the chaos of mumbai
text:
It's a nice hotel ,however I feel that the hotel should have been a 4 star rather than 5 .

If we talk about 5 star hotel , I would have an impression that everything would be spotlessly clean , which wasn't the case . The interiors of the hotel were pretty old . Door knobs polish were gone , the bathroom fittings were rusty and not shining . I felt that there was a need to overhaul the furnishings as mentioned above . 

Regarding the exterior the hotel was good , as mentioned in many reviews the swimming pool is a big attraction for all the guests visiting the place . The beach outiside is a big let down as it's in a pathetic shape . 

The staff were very welcoming and we're wishing always anyone would see you . The house keeping response was quite delayed if you asked something from them . To my surprise the WiFi is chargeable and even some of the toiletries like moisturizer, which is a shame . Haven't ever seen moisturizer been charged by any of the hotels ever . 

Food was ok , but I didn't feel it was of a 5 star standard . On the last day dinner we ordered a pizza and for 500 bucks the size of the pizza was small with just 4 slices .

title: Beaches are calling..
text:
The Retreat
As the name suggests this place caters for people who are coming up to relax a bit & also for corporate groups.

The place is very much inside & away from city hustle & also bears an old look. The lobby is pretty huge.. It's like walking from starting point to the end of the building to get to reception from the main porch..

Room given was good.. However, it shows evidently that the somewhat long due maintenance is pending.. They also had certain activities planned for their in-house guest .. The concierge person who will escort you will inform you about the same while in an elevator while the same was also depicted on the elevator wall.. A good use of the time I guess.. Stayed in Plam tree facing villa & though the view was not as great it gives you a peaceful feeling from inside..

Food was good.. only ordered it from room service

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for selecting The Retreat Hotel & Convention Centre, Mumbai as your accommodation choice and for taking the time to share your compliments with us.

title: Decent weekend retreat
text:
As we didn't want to travel too far and wanted to have a swim, good food & relaxation we chose The Retreat. 
The 
Front desk staff was courteous so was the other hotel staff. the food was good but the choices are limited in a-la-carte & waiting time is really long. as we booked from the hotel website we were offered a discount of 25% on food.

The pool is well maintained & is really great.The Jacuzzi too is well functioning & good fun. The gym is large but not really well equipped. More machines must be added. The steam room for gents was not working but the hotel did make alternative arrangements. the garden is  well maintained. 

The double bed was large and other amenities decent. Elevators are really fast and require hardly any waiting. Breakfast was typical of 5-star hotels without much novelty. Wi-Fi was free but worked mostly in the hotel lobby only.

The taps & shower in the toilet have kind of salty water. 

The hotel rooms & toilets definitely require a make over. somehow i found the hotel understaffed. Some more interest from the management can turn this place around.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest

Thank you for sharing your review about the hotel in your recent stay with us. 

Your feedback regarding the food and chef is appreciated, and we thank you for the same as it motivates the staff in providing the same level of service to the guests.

Please note the points highlighted regarding the rooms maintenance have been noted and will be acted upon.

At the outset we thank you for choosing The Retreat Hotel & Convention Centre Mumbai and we look forward to welcoming you again.
placeInfo/address: Madh Island Marve Road Malad West, Mumbai 400061 India

title: Value for money
text: This is an old hotel with a running lift installed probably in the 60's. However, why it deserves 4 stars is its excellent location and value for money. If you are looking for a clean, good space to stay with decent service, good connectivity to all parts of the city, do not think twice. This is especially so if your business in south Mumbai or around. It is close to both the main local stations and taxi is available through the day and night. Getting every type of food around is also not a problem. I have been a patron for 8 years and have never had an issue with service or a bit of flexibility wrt checkout times.

title: Well located , old world charm , great value for money .
text: I stayed in a double room for 4 nights . Room was big , well ventilated but as hotel is in a business district not much of views . The hotel has an old world charm. Staff is courteous & efficient .  Location is excelent , is a 10 minutes walk from Marine Drive & Church Gate Station . Plenty of Restaurants & Cinemas in the vicinity .  The restaurant serves good food and three buffets a day .  The only major drawback I found was that the TV had limited channels . Could not catch up with the India Australia matches . The management needs to understand that guests come from all over India & world , and when relaxing in the room after a tiring day , TV helps unwind watching your favourite programs . Hotels need to carry all channels today to suite the guests tastes .  Had a great stay  & recommend highly for the price .
ownerResponse/text:

I want to thank you for taking the time to share your stay experience with us.
We thank you for appreciating our central location old world charm & great value for money. Management does understand the importance of TV for relaxing in the room. We will certainly increase our TV channels so that sports & news worldwide can be viewed.
Please let us know when you are visiting us next time. I would like to meet you in person & thank you once again.

Yours Faithfully,

              Arjun Ramani
           General Manager

title: Nous sommes fidèles
text:
Nous sommes des clients réguliers depuis des années, et le West End nous le rend bien.
Certes vieillot, mais très propre et très bien situé, cet hôtel nous convient parfaitement.
Le personnel - et le propriétaire, régulièrement présent - sont très aimables et attentionnés.
Idéal pour des séjours en Inde assez longs et des aller-retours à Bombay, pendant lesquels on laisse des bagages et retrouve souvent la même chambre ." welcome back home" disent-ils.

title: Falls short of expectations
text:
I was on a business trip and had stayed in this hotel for 5 days.
The hotel has an old world charm, but it has not moved on to include the modern ammenities.

Pro's:
1. Very close to CST and Chruchgate, and right in the middle of the business district.
2. Comfortable and clean rooms
3. Dinner buffet is very good and fresh

Con's:
1. There were cockroaches in the bathroom. I tired to call the floor steward, but he was no where to be found.
2. Breakfast has sweets from previous night, e.g. Gulab jamuns from the night before are served next morning breakfast.
3. Lifts are not available on the way down. The lift door is kept open on the ground floor to service people going up, so not available if you want to come down. Out of the five days I got the lift only once to come down.
4. No free internet: it looks like a commercial decision, but for the frequent modern day business traveller is a must. The Internet rates are too high. In almost all good hotels around the world Internet is complimentary to the hotel room.
I might stay here again if I do not get any other option.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear  Guest,

Thank you for taking out your valuable time to fill this review.

We are regularly doing pest control & we are sorry for the inconvenience caused to you.

Both our lifts have lift-man & doors are always kept opens. Upon hearing the bell the lift-man goes to the particular floor to attend the guest. We are very sorry, that your experience about lift was not up-to the mark. We thank you for appreciating our Dinner and we will endeavor our Breakfast menu. Some hotels in South Mumbai charge for WiFi and some offer it free. We hope to serve you again in the future.

Sincerely,
 
                  Arjun Ramani
               General Manager
        West End Hotel,Mumbai
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Difficult to find, unknown to the neighbors........
text:
Stayed at West End on Marine Lines overnight as a business traveller. Not only that the radio cab that I hired from the Mumbai Int'l Airport knew about the hotel, but none of the cabbies and autorickshaw wallahs standing on the Marine Lines could direct us where the Hotel is. Finally, 5th attempt succeeded and we could get to the hotel. The reception staff at 12.30 in the night certainly was not in a mood to welcome with a smile but other staff were as smiling as if it was receiving the first guest in a new hotel. There was no place whatsoever to find any food outlet open at that hour of the night in the neighborhood and predictably hotel had nothing to offer to its guests arriving late in the night.
The room was neat and clean, spacious and modestly decorated. The breakfast was average with limited choices, but food served during the meeting was a big disappointment. In my opinion,  with some efforts it can become a good heritage hote (established in 1948)l!
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

We thank you for taking out your time to fill this review.

We do have a reliable, safe & economical pickup/drop service from the Airport which you perhaps may like to try on your next visit to save the inconvenience caused to you during your last visit. We apologize  that the reception that you received was not as good as it should have been. From midnight to 07.00 a.m. we do have a limited service menu.

Some of our regular customers send us email about their meal requirement & it is served to them when they arrive between midnight to 07.00 a.m.

Thank you for appreciating our rooms and we hope to be at your service in future.

Sincerely,

              Arjun Ramani

title: Not worth
text:
Good AC.

Friendly staff.

Congested  room & bathroom.

Hotel rates are around a 4 or 5 star, but services are pathetic, no complimentary  wifi or breakfast, no water bottles complimentary  except 1 for a day.

Lifts are horrible.

Dining food is bad, sweets in morning are leftovers of previous night. Even noon buffet  had some flying insects on deserts (mousse)

Mosquitoes  in room.

I took a smoking room and, smoke wasnt escaping out, very bad ventilation.

Balcony are for show off, very congested and not worth to be called as balcony.

Sorrounding  area is also very very congested and cheap crowd staring and stalking  as you leave the hotel premises.

IN SHORT, GET ANOTHER NICE PLACE IN SAME PRICE.
YOU WILL END  UP WITH AN ACTUAL  5 STAR FOR THE MONEY REQUIRED HERE.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Pranav, 

Greetings from West End Hotel, Mumbai.
 Thank you for your valuable feedback and we apologize for the inconvenience caused to you; during your recent stay with us.
               In south Mumbai 4 star hotels charges about Rs. 5500/- & 5 star about Rs. 7500/- per day per room for an individual (17.42% Tax Extra). Whereas our room tariff is Rs. 4500/- + Taxes & other offers are as follows:-
1) Extra person in single room free.
2) Early Bird – book 21 days in advance & get 20% discount.
3) Stay 2 nights & get 03rd night @ 20% discount.
4) Long stay offer – A) 4-10 nights 10% discount 
                                  B) 11-15 nights 15% discount
                                  C) 16 nights & above 20% discount.
Some hotels do offer free Wi-Fi & some hotels charge for it. We have two rates one for room with breakfast & one for room only basis. You have opted for room only.

We never had any guests complain about mosquito or flying insects till now. Every floor has a butler to look after your needs & to give you highly personalized service.

Your room was 250 Sq. Feet (1 n half ton & air conditioned) so the ventilation should have sufficient. For additional ventilation the door leading to the small balcony could have been opened &  lot of fresh sea breezes could have entered the room
        We are surrounded by Bombay Hospital, central government offices, metro adlabs cinema, other offices sometimes the area does gets congested. Our lifts are old but well maintained. Our hotel is old but our customers say it has old world charm.

We wish that you will stay with us on next visit & we will make every effort to make your stay a happy one.

Sincerely,

                  Arjun Ramani
                General Manager
          West End Hotel, Mumbai
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Banquet Review
text:
4th October, which was a big day for me. It was my engagement. It would be a bad part of me if i would not write a review for this Lovely hotel. First of all Thank you to Mr. Joy, Who is the Banquet Manager who performed his duties Simply Perfect.!! Thumbs up to him. This hotel is known to my family and we have attended family functions here. This time i would say it was my function and i wanted to be cautious about every little thing. I would say we had a crowd of 125 people for the engagement and we had been given the top terrace banquet for the function. It was well furnished with Tables and chairs covered with white cloth which looked beautiful. The arrangement of the stage was perfect as we wanted it with tables on each side. 

The bar was set up amazing with no soda's which were less for the function. The starters were amazing it matched perfectly with the booze we had. The food was delicious and good quantity which was enough for the crowd. The seating arrangement for food outside on the terrace was amazing. I would say they left no stone unturned to make the function successful. 

The staff is courteous and helpful in everything we needed. I would say this hotel is new but with modern thoughts and amenities. Its no less then the biggest hotels in B town.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Affordable, Enjoyable and Lovable
text: The rooms are quite spacious and well maintained. The view may not be so great as it is centrally located but it is well connected to various parts of the busy city of Mumbai; theatres, hospitals, malls, railway station etc. and to the beautiful Queens necklace (the Marine Drive), thus, making it the perfect venue to stay and dine; and have a great quality time. The hotel and it's friendly staff have never failed to live up to our expectations. Our love for food and pampering our taste buds is only heightened by the lovely cuisine offered at their inhouse restaurant, which by me is the USP of the hotel. That's what makes this place so special to our heart. For us, West End Hotel, Mumbai is definately a name to be considered and in our list of favorites by default.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Old School Grandeur
text:
The West End hotel is definitely not for the new age traveller...be prepared to take a step into the old world, with grill cage lifts....old style rooms...and a huge bathtub. The bathrooms have been renovated, so that's up to date. The hotel is strategically located, so that it's easily accessible to city sights, restaurants, etc. The food is decent, but since you're in Bombay, would be more fun to eat out. 

Count on being transported to a different era.....and then in that mode, staying in this hotel is well worth it.

title: Average room, friendly service
text:
I was in Mumbai on a study abroad and had little knowledge of what to expect when we arrived.  The staff proved to be friendly enough providing many things we requested or needed.  The rooms are roomy, simple, and satisfarctorily clean:  The furniture dated but clean.  Internet is NOT free and is not easily used all over the hotel.  I had the best access when nearer to the front of the building rather than in my room in the back.  

There was a horrible smell in the hallway leading to my room--I didn't smell this all over, just in that part of the hall.  The air conditioning worked well in my room and the temperature was kept very comfortable.  The bathroom was sufficient in that it offered all necessary amenities, though the tub was very tall and a bit difficult to climb into.

The buffet offered is sufficient, even offering a few "American" breakfast choices (eggs, fruit, cereal--the milk is warm, FYI).  The service is quick and very pleasing.  Overall I was pleased with our stay.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Stay in Mumbai
text:
Me and wife stayed at this property a few days ago for two nights.

Location- the property is located in the heart of Mumbai next to the Dadar Station on the eastern side. 
Although Dadar is known to be a crowded area, it is predominantly the Western area which is more crowded than the Eastern section. 
This property is located just across the swami narayanan temple.

Amenities- being a 4 star hotel, all amenities like swiming pool, gym, restaurant, etc

Room - the room we got was pretty spacious - had a division seperate for living and bed space, had a seperate walk in wardrobe, nice washroom and is kept very neat and clean

Overall the hotel and its staff were generally good but we felt the bell boys to be more responsible than thr reception staff as both during check in and check out we noticed the reception staff to be engrossed in their personal discussions instead of keeping Customer intrests at the prime.

title: A modest hotel that is well located
text:
It is essential to understand the dynamics of Mumbai while selecting a hotel. One needs to consider the location and budget while deciding the luxury. This hotel justifies its price with its central location and addressing all basic requirements one would expect from the hotel. If you are looking for a luxury hotel that is also well located then the budget will need to be atleast doubled.

This is my 3rd stay in this hotel and will be spending over 5 nights with family. The services are upto mark and dont disappoint at all. The restaurant is modest and the prices of drinks are in line with other hotels in similar range. 

If you are tourist then this is very located as the time to Bandra, Parel and Marine Drive will mostly be the same. if you are on business then you need to evaluate the hotel based on the location of your office. If your office is in South Mumbai, BKC or Dadar then this may be a good choice. 

While the hotel is a bit dated, the rooms are clean and the staff is very courteous. 

Overall, a very nice stay if one can appreciate the modesty required in Mumbai.

title: Very unprofessional - Thinking of cancelling my booking.
text:
I booked a room from Germany in a website to stay from 11th to 16th of January 2017. As per the website I booked, early check-in must be possible in this hotel. Nevertheless, they gave the phone number to verify it with the property. ie the Ramee Guestline Hotel Dadar. I was ready to pay for the extra hours that I am going to check in early.

I called the hotel to clarify about the procedures for an early checkin. Someone answered the phone. I somehow did not feel good with the irresponsible response that person gave me. The way they talked is not so polite. The person on the other end responded to my query as if she does not care if I stay in this hotel or not. So I am reconsidering to cancel my booking. Poor hospitality in their speech in general.

I highly doubt if my stay here would be ever pleasing. I would not want someone to spoil my mood like this during my 6 days of business visit to India. I do not even know if i could cancel my booking and be refunded. Because, I paid the money as a whole after reading good reviews here. But the reality is otherwise.
 I do not know about the ameneties of the hotel yet. But I sure the people who work there may not be that hospitable.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for the feedback, We have investigated the matter and briefed the concerned staff with all seriousness, Sometimes in spite of our best intentions things go wrong, I assure you for the good future experience please call me on under number so that can take a personal care right from your booking, we deeply regret for the same,

title: Smell of dry fish, uffff and poorly maintained
text:
A group of friends and kids visited over the weekend of 5 May. As soon as we got off a strong smell of dry fish hit us from nowhere. When we asked at reception, the ladies said by evening it wont be so bad! No choice since we had prepaid and once up to our room(2nd floor) it took 2 men from the housekeeping to open the doors to our rooms. The rooms need refurb.asap! Old bathrooms, broken toilet roll holder, leaky basin taps, mirrors above the basin in which you cannot see yourself at all! We went to the beach and the dry fish stench was so bad we came back within minutes. The fish is dried right outside the hotel at the back entrance near the beach.
Food is good. We had breakfast, lunch, tandoori, chinese starters. Pool is decent.

Reception staff seemed in sour mood and did not make us feel welcome, no smile, answered a couple of our questions with a load of attitude but we friends were in a great mood to enjoy our weekend so ignored it!
ownerResponse/text:

Thank you for selecting The Retreat Hotel & Convention Centre, Mumbai as your accommodation choice and for taking the time to share your compliments with us.

The fish smell is out of the hotel's control as the local fishermen use the beach adjacent to the hotel to dry their fish. At the hotel, we are doing our best to reduce the impact of smell by having agarbatis outside the hotel and deodorizes inside.

title: Nice place for weekend getaway
text:
Had a 1 night stay at this luxury hotel. Its a few miles away from the city along the road to Madh Island. So you'll get the perfect feel of a koli(fishing) village en route. Booked a pool view room and luckily it also gave a perfect view of the sea. Its right beside the Erangal beach (of Sagar movie fame). It has its own private entrance for the beach. The pool is pretty well maintained. There's a separate pool for kids so my kid enjoyed too. The rooms are also big and well maintained. The bathroom was neat and clean too (as expected from a 5 * facility.) 

The lunch and dinner buffets had a variety of dishes (both veg & non veg). Though the prices were on the higher side, the food quality was good. The staff is also very courteous. 

The bed mattress can be better though. Its a spring mattress and gave us backaches. Otherwise the bed size was big enough for a couple and a kid. 

This place has its own convention center, gym, massage parlor & kids play area too. So a good location for company outings as well.

title: Keep expectations low and you'll like it
text:
Good property although there is all pervading stench of rotten fish all over, because of the fishing boats bringing in their haul on the beach adjoining the property. The highlight is the wonderfully maintained pool with a little waterfall, sunken bar, a hot tub jacuzzi and a cute little island bang in the middle of the pool. The staff does make an effort but service leaves a lot to be desired...especially the security at the gate who went sniffing into the car, which was awkward as my elderly aunt and 10 year old niece was with us. 
As for food, stay away from the Chinese and its ok...average in quality and service. 
There aren't any outdoor activities for children so unless one is in the pool, there isn't anything to do outside for children. There is some arrangement for indoor games. 
The rooms are fine and the pool facing rooms allow one to wake up to a lovely view.
If one is not expecting great stuff and is ok with average, then this is a fine place for a weekend stay over.

placeInfo/address: Madh Island Marve Road Malad West, Mumbai 400061 India

title: Nice property, attentive service, rooms need improvement
text:
We were looking for a one-day getaway on a long weekend AND didn't want crowds! That's like asking for the moon! But we found a perfect hide-out right in our backyard! The Retreat was just 35 km from where we stay. It still takes an hour an half to get there. Best is to let a cabbie drive you there.
Nicely maintained property especially the lawns and the swimming pool. Attentive help, especially our pool attendant. The pool is the highlight. Multiple sections. Not very deep, so can't dive or do professional swimming but for most, it is more than adequate. Beautiful waterfall in the pool that massages you. A small jacuzzi with heated water too.
The restaurant (Oriental Bowl for dinner) was nice. Spacious, and because there were few people, quiet and perfect for our needs.
The breakfast was average though. Again, the staff was very attentive and responsive.
The negatives were:
1. A strong smell of drying fish hits you as soon as you come up to the hotel lobby. The smell does disappear once you are on the premises and does not come up again.
2. The rooms are very spacious but not very well maintained. Definitely could improve.
3. What was most objectionable was that the basin tap had salty water coming out of it. They provide only one! Small bottle of mineral water per room per day. They do offer unlimited RO potable water, but you need to keep asking for refills.
4. And a big no-no! - There is no free wi-fi! They charge for everything. What they fail to realize is that data is so cheap! It costs nothing except goodwill to provide free wifi. In any case, each mobile has tons of data available, so will somebody ever subscribe to their wifi???!!!
ownerResponse/text:

title: Sad experience!
text:
1. Property- The property is decent, but has lost most of its charm. A bad whiff of fishes resonates throughout the grounds though they take failed efforts by burning incense at some places.

2. Room- The interiors of the room are alright with us having got a “palm-facing” view which is nothing but a sad view of the parking lot. The AC system kept making a buzzing sound through the night, which caused a disturbed sleep. 

3. Food- The food tastes very average with only the Malabari Fish Curry tasting like it is supposed to taste. No idea why their food is so darned expensive! To top it all, after having the lunch buffet the second day, my husband fell ill with multiple bouts of loose motions throughout the night with us getting very little sleep due to it. 

4. Staff behaviour- The front desk is not trained well on speaking with the guests. Rude and unprofessional. We did not even get proper clarity on our bill break up. We checked out and left in anger without the front desk giving two hoots about our disappointment. The other staff is good though. 

5. Verdict- We are never coming back here.

title: Average rooms, great location, good food.
text:
I stayed here for 3 days and 2 nights and had an average experience. First off, the location is excellent. It is walking distance from Churchgate station and really close to Colaba as well. 
The hotel looks and feels really old. All the furniture and the interior is quite dates. Having said this, I suppose it contributes to the charm of the hotel. The staff is adequately helpful but they don't go out of the way to be polite. 
The rooms are very spacious and the beds are okay. I must point out again that all the furniture, fixture, cupboards and dressers etc are very old and dated. The bathrooms have been modernized with marble/granite and are decent. I must say the the floors of the room were not very clean. 
The restaurant downstairs has really nice food. The spread is value for money and the food is quite fresh and tasty.That's the hotel in a nutshell - old hotel, polite staff, excellent location, very nice food.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Not value for price
text:
Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in Feb-14. The location is pretty good, if you have work in South Mumbai. However, for the room price, the facilities are not upto the mark. The lift is British-era and definitely needs replacement. I was given a corner room and the room was spacious, and the bathroom was great. However, the bed and bedsheets etc. were quite old. Room service was prompt, however, the charges were exorbitant and the quantities were less than expected.
The staff is very nice and courteous.
However, I would recommend people to find a cheaper alternative if they plan to stay in South Mumbai.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good experience
text: Very spacious room, courteous staff.  I liked the old world feel to the hotel and the rooms. Spent only few hours at the hotel itself.  Room was clean, functional and utilitarian.  Location could not have been better.  Based on my experience in Mumbai, great value for money.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Comfortable place, good location
text: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel in December 2013. I landed up at 6 am and they checked me into my room without slapping any extra charges for early arrival (which most hotels would have done) and that was great. The establishment dates back to 1947, the year India got independence and the management clearly wants to preserve this old-world charm, which I very much appreciated. My (double) room was quite spacious and clean. I especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet in the morning, which was very extensive, with many cooked dishes. I remember the lunch buffet being great as well. Since this is an old building, there was some issue with the light bulbs etc, but the management fixed it up very well. The only unreasonable part was the wifi, which I had to pay for, and which was quite expensive, around Rs 160/hour, if I remember correctly. Other than that, a great experience.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: The west end ?
text: It isn't. The first impression on walking in, its a throwback to the 80s. I asked the receptionist about this. he said the owners want to keep it that way. Some may like it, I didn't. Having said that, the rooms were clean and large(not found in this area), furniture is antique or dated(take your pick), room service was prompt, AC worked well and toilet was clean with hot water from the shower in plenty. Sleep quality was not bad but there was a little traffic noise.A tea-heater would be nice in the rooms and it would help if the wifi was free. Breakfast is a buffet but forget taste, it was lousy. The immediate area around the hotel isn't the best. Lots of beggars but I never felt unsafe, just pestered. Stay here again ? Yes ONLY if I had business in the area, otherwise probably not.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: good standard
text:
I liked my time at the west end.  rooms are clean, basic and the service is also of good quality.  I thought the breakfast buffet was very tasty.  would be happy to come back and stay again.

small note - the free wifi isn't actually free though - slight disappointment really, but on my travels at least the rate here wasn't as bad as others.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good, clean and basic - excellent, attentive room service
text: My boyfriend and I stayed here as part of our month in India, we had 3 days in Mumbai. The room was spacious and pretty clean. We had a problem with no cold water in the shower which was fixed immediately. Room service was excellent, extremely quick and efficient. The restaurant was expensive for what you get - breakfast was average. You also have to pay for wifi which always feels like a cheek when a lot of lower priced hotels offer it for free. The man who checked us in on reception was very abrupt and brusque and answered every question as if you should know the answer. He also told us you have to have a separate wifi voucher for each device - not true!! So don't listen - other than him the service really was great though. Would recommend if you're looking for something close to the tourist attractions at a reasonable price.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Not quite the West End.
text: We lunched here and the food choice was good as were the waiters who were helpful and attentive. We later returned to change clothes and wait our sleeper train journey to Goa. The room was a bit shabby and well dated but a good size and the a/c worked fine. We tried out the hotel bar, which must date back to the 80's, but the waiters were very friendly and continuously topped up our table snacks, which were all free of charge.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Hotel at key location
text: This is at key location and very close very close to churchgate station.Though from the furniture and rooms, you can understand it is very old hotel but well maintained and neat and clean.staff is very prompt and offers good service
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Solid choice based on cost
text:
I first stayed here in March 2009 and have been there on and off for the following 2 years. It is not by choice, but rather due to cost. An average room costs around $120.00 NZ a night. AC is noisy, the rooms are very basic, room service is ridiculously expensive, breakfast menu is berry berry predictable BUT and there is a very big BUT..... The location compared to almost other triple the price hotels is very central and the staff (from the front desk, room service, lift boys to the car parking attendants) are amazing.....
When you enter the lobby, it feels like you have honestly stepped back in time.....huge big fans, decor to match and all that is missing is the ladies with fringe hats and the gentlemen looking dapper smoking cigars....

Rooms
Above average in size that normally has an AC window that has a bucket to catch excess water and that needs to be emptied daily. They do have baby cots, but I wouldn't recommend as I saw them repaint one with lead paint. There are smoking floors and the smell if you walk down the stairs is vulgar. 

Room service
Costs an arm and a leg. Like most hotels, the food is bland and generic. The indian food is a combination of western/india and the continental food is the same lol..... Generally room service is quick and you can ask for just about anything. I called reception and asked if someone could go and get some medicine for me as my baby was asleep and it was no trouble. Granted that the Bombay Hospital is opposite and there are literally hundreds of chemists/pharmacys everywhere.

Environment
As the hotel is located next to the Bombay Hospital, outside there are literally hundreds of people with all sorts of ailments. Generally the noise level in the room is fine, although the AC can be at times noisy. If there is a function on the top floor/terrace - this will change.....the elevator will be blocked for hours as it is small and houses maybe 4 or 5 at a push and the music is unbelievably loud - but will finish at around 11 or 12. 

Security
I always felt safe both in and around the hotel. I would often go for walks in the evening with my 2 children and although there are beggars, street dwellers and sick people I never felt unsafe. One of the hotel boys if asked will accompany you up and down the street for quick supplies. 

Car Parking and or transport
Taxis live outside the hotel so you will always find a cab. Get the price per km first before you even hop in. 
If you have a car although parking is limited the attendants will find you a place. 

Do not go cheaper and book with Hotel Sapna or Hotel Fortune which is about a 2 minute walk away....the rooms are a quarter, no, no an eighth of the size and although looks cleanish...they both certainly are not....

I have to add that the majority of people that stayed here while I was there seemed to be business people. I was there with my husband and 2 children (2 years and 9 months) and as noted earlier we stayed there on and off for about 2 years (possibly a total of 10 stays). This was due to us visiting Mumbai to oversee our house being renovated. The staff always accomodated our needs, bringing hot water to heat bottles, using bottled water to wash and sterilise bottles, heating baby food for us etc.....
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Great location, great value for money
text: A great little hotel in a fabulous location. Near Churchgate Station, this hotel is based in the south of Mumbai, making it easy to access all the main hotspots and sites. A clean and simple hotel, it is the staff that make this place a great place to stay. So much so, I go back every year!
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: A very Good Business staying place

I stayed at this hotel recently on a work related trip. Most important thing for me was very very convenient location right in front of Bombay Hospital. Nearby access to Churchgate station, Marine Drive sea face.

Rooms were large and well maintained.

The building is old but charming.

title: Great hotel and competitively priced

title: Nice hotel, good Location
text:
Located exactly opposite the Bombay Hospital, the West End Hotel is a pretty old hotel, and we found the facilities comfortable and the staff pleasant. The most impressive feature of the hotel is the size of the rooms. They are pretty spacious. The bathrooms are good too, and clean. 
we felt safe here , amenites and facilties are quite antiquated for the price we paid. Location was okay.

title: Un hotel indiano di standard europeo
text:
All'arrivo ci accoglie uno staff gentile e sollecito. Le stanze hanno un ottimo livello qualità - prezzo e, considerati gli standard di rumore di Mumbai, sono silenziose. Il breakfast buffet e' di buona qualità, come pure il ristorante. La posizione e' centrale ed il lungomare e' raggiungibile a piedi.
La vicinanza di una delle più grandi strutture ospedaliere e di un posto di Polizia contribuisce a dare al viaggiatore una sensazione di sicurezza. Nelle vicinanze, numerosi negozi, piccoli caffè e ristoranti tipici, di cui alcuni nuovi e molto puliti. Al ritorno in camera tutto funziona, compresa l'aria condizionata! Una struttura alberghiera che raccomando e nella quale, in caso tornassi a Mumbai, vorrei ritornare.
