title: Old hotel, but worth staying at if you have work nearby
text:
Located exactly opposite the Bombay Hospital, the West End Hotel is a pretty old hotel, though well-maintained. I have stayed at this hotel often, and always found the facilities comfortable and the staff pleasant.

The most impressive feature of the hotel is the size of the rooms. They are pretty spacious and airy. The bathrooms are good too, and clean. The lobby and the reception area is also of a decently-large size. The restaurant is satisfactory. Like I said, I have stayed here often, and I have no inclination of looking for any other hotel if I have work in South Mumbai.

title: A comfortable stay
text: I stayed in the hotel while on a business travel. The location of the hotel is very near to the Dadar railway station which can be an advantage for a train traveler. The rooms of the hotel are comfortable and the the hotel is very clean. The food was also good.
placeInfo/address: Opp. Swami Narayan Temple Dadar (E), Mumbai, Mumbai 400014 India

title: “ Quaint and Cosy  ”
text:
As I was in Mumbai for a conference , I chose this hotel as it was closest to KEM hospital. In terms of location, it is located just next to Swami Narayan temple , so it is easy to get to.
The hotel is quaint and petite ....everything is located so very close to each other from the doorway to the reception area and breakfast room. The people at the reception are very helpful at any given time and as I had an online booking , I had no delays in being checked in once they verified my booking . ( I’d like to mention that Nidha at the reception was very polite ,helpful and so very jolly , as were the other staff at the reception and breakfast hall). For the tourists/backpackers that are looking for an economical stay , this hotel is apt as it comes with all the amenities and it is surrounded by a variety of shops and the Swami Narayan temple that many people flock to.
I was given the room on the 5th floor. I had booked the club room with two single beds. The view was....well of the opposite building which you can expect when in Mumbai.There are two chairs kept facing the window which is quite nice when you sit down for tea in the evenings. The room floor I found to be a tad dirty with stains here and there but can be ignored if you are not too finicky about it. The various snacks kept within the room were over priced especially if one knows the actual prices of these items outside. The bathroom is clean but if you are travelling with older people , like parents or grandparents , the shower is a bit tedious to get to and one can easily slip as there are no wet mats placed outside the bath tub area.
 The bed linen surprisingly was clean, with few to no stains and the air conditioning fully functional. In this quaint hotel I found something very unique .There are three buttons located near the key card area ; Make up room /Laundry/Do not disturb ... so if by mistake you press any of these three buttons, then you can be sure that before you return from breakfast your room will be cleaned and beds made .     
The breakfast buffet was a let down I have to say. There are South Indian items like dosa , idli and vada . On one day there were pooris served which I found to be very oily and not very edible .The croissants and cupcakes served were very stale both the days. The curd kept was very sour on both days . I did not venture out to eat the various cereals that were laid out. The fruits were the only saving grace on the menu. On the second day of my stay I wanted my eggs sunny side up /bulls eye but I found the white part of the egg to be undercooked , which I brought to the attention of the waiter but all he did was flip the egg over and fry it on both sides....its a small thing but could have been handled better.
The hotel has a pool on the roof but on both the days I was there , the pool was locked up ...which was a little disappointing. The gym area is too small for more than 2 people to be working out in.
Good hotel for short stays ...and quite economical.
placeInfo/address: Opp. Swami Narayan Temple Dadar (E), Mumbai, Mumbai 400014 India

title: Excellent Location & Comfortable Stay
text:
I visited Ramee guestline Dadar in May 1st week & stayed for 1 night, i had visited mumbai to attend 1 day conference, my company booked it for me as it is 10 min drive to Parel, very convenient location not too far from the Airport, reception staff is great & check in was smooth only 5 minutes. An executive club room allotted to me on 1 st floor , very spacious room, well appointed with all amenities and well stocked washroom. Room service/housekeeping staff very polite and prompt.

Food was OK, very spicey but highly over priced. breakfast spread was decent 

overall a good stay, you can find good quality numerous eating options nearby at walkable distance.

title: Like staying with family
text: I loved staying at this hotel.  The staff makes you feel like family.  I know we come to expect little things that never happen, like the cleaning staff conveniently sneaking in to clean while you're out, or a "breakfast included" that is actually warm and made just for you, but this never seems to be the case.  This is exactly how Ramee Dadar treats their guests.  The staff is very informative and don't mind answering your questions.  In fact, they will gather around and debate what is best for you and then lay out the options.  Like family!  All this, and the location to the city center is perfect.  I would not stay anywhere else in Mumbai.

title: Old hotel- decent location
text: As a woman travelling alone I felt safe here but the rooms are old, amenites and facilties are quite antiquated for the price I paid. Noisy and poorly furnished. Location was okay- walkable to Marine Drive and Churchgate.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Nice hotel, good service, excellent food.
text:
When it comes to good food and spending quality time with your family/children outside; West End Hotel, Mumbai is one of those places.

We have since our childhood experienced this place. Now we planned and celebrated our child's 1st birthday. The staff, their support and the excellent food made our occasion; a GRAND success.

Looking forward to visiting the place... again!
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Dingy hotel, poor value
text: I know that Mumbai is an expensive city for rooms, even though it is in India.  However, the West End rooms are way overpriced.  They are dingy and poorly furnished.  My wife and I booked a junior suite to have a relatively superior room. However, the junior suite they gave us was especially dark and gloomy.  We requested a downgrade to a regular room, which was a little better.  At the end of the stay they refused to adjust the room price because we had pre-booked through Agoda, so we were forced to pay for a junior suite.  We complained to the assistant manager, who refused to do anything or even give me his name.  The best feature of the hotel was the friendly staff (not management).
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Great stay
text: I have been staying in West End now for more than 25 years. As usual, I find the hotel most convenient, clean with friendly and helpful staff. when in Mumbai I never look for any other options even when I on a holiday with my family.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: business hotel
text:
I have stayed there 2 nights with friends,rooms are spacious,neat with normal decoration,
breakfast not enclouded and very expensive.
location is good for whom that have patient in Mumbai Hospital , or whom need to be near to train station.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Basic suite in reasonable hotel, a little pricey.
text: We booked an A/C suite for our family of four. The suite was very basic with a large lounge area and large bedroom with two double beds. As with many other hotels in India, cleanliness could have been better. However for a i night stop over in Mumbai, it was OK. The restaurant is OK, if a little overpriced.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Basic hotel
text:
The hotel is located in the Marine Lines opposite the Mumbai Hospital. The price for single occupancy will set you back 5000+ rupees. (70 £) which is expensive given that for 30£ more you can stay in the Intercontinental.  They hotel claims 3* but by International standard should be 1.5-2

Location: good
Comforts:basic
Price: high for what's on offer
hygiene: clean
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Old and functional, strictly on budget - better choices prevail,
text:
The biggest reason you would chose this is because you have someone lodged in mumbai hospital as its just across it or you are a sucker and this is a deal in 5000 bucks ( single) and this gives you access to local train stations.
Seriously - 
An old hotel with bad rooms, 
split AC pointed on your head, 
blankets in place of comforters, 
bad pillows, 
worn down furniture and amenities which would be luxury when launched some 100 years ago, walkway filled with beggars and destitute – not something that you can keep up with or it can remind of some old charm.

I dont see any reason
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Very Nice
text: We stayed at the West End hotel and it is nice. The rooms are very spacious, clean. The attendant staff on my floor and front office are very helpful. This hotel is close to Marine line and churchgate railway station. The West End is so well placed to get to the main tourist sites around the Gateway of India. etc. There are hotels taxi which takes you to all the yourist spots and they too are helpful.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Older hotel with special charm
text: We stayed at the WEH on the recommendation of a physician at the Bombay Hospital ( across the street) where a family member was hospitalized. This hotel is  old for sure, but has clean rooms that are large by European standards. The furniture is old, but clean, the bed was comfortable, each floor has a housekeeping attendant who you buzz if anything is needed. 3rd and 4th floor are non smoking, and AC ( which was very loud, but worked) is in the room.  Guests ran the gammut from business travelers, European holiday travelers, solo and group, Indians, Africans, Asians. WIFI is by purchase- ( 700 ruppees for 7 hours time).  The shower is great- hot water with real pressure. You are provided small bars of soap and a small packet of shampoo, and each shower has a supply of shower gel in a dispenser. Its location is good for venturing out with quite a few eateries along the surrounding streets. This is old Bombay. I must say the resstaurant in this hotel - "The Gourmet Restaurant" is great.Classic decor, with old world service - very fresh ingedients for both indian and continental menus and you can order a drink from the bar with dinner. The service is beyond compare- it is restraunteuring the way it was years ago. It is frequented by locals and hotel guests. There is also a nice buffet for breakfast lunch and dinner. The hoel also has a bar Chez Nous, that time has forgotten, but it is worth a visit.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: VERY DECENT, Almost nn par with what you pay.
text: the service was alright, the rooms are spacious and good with all that, that  you need. they old which i kinda liked. clean! the receptionist wasnt too sweet or friendly bt wasnt too bad either. location very good only if you know Bombay well. Otherwise, its still in the heart bt little difficult. wouldnt mind again.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Delightful reminder of olde worlde grace and charm
text: I stayed at the West End hotel during the third week of November 2012. The rooms are very spacious, clean and bathrooms have an excellent shower. The attendant staff on my floor were delightfully attentive, extremely helpful and those on the reception went out of their way to make my stay as pleasurable as possible. As an example, when I was unsure as to the location of a particular place, the person on reception went online and personally called the place to find a local landmark that I could give the taxi driver to make sure I got there ok!! There is an olde world grace and charm to this hotel, with its bellboys and restaurant staff in their pristine uniforms. I know there are glitzier places in Mumbai that probably have more modern fixtures and fittings, but i'd much rather stay in this charming hotel with a soul than somewhere more glamorous but possessed of a cold and indifferent demeanour. The West End is so well placed to get to the main tourist sites around the Gateway of India. If I ever come back to Mumbai, i wouldn't stay anywhere else, not even the Taj. What a treasure!!
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good location budget hotel
text: Very pleasant stay, large room, very good bathroom & shower facilities. Huge choice for breakfast to set you up for the days adventure. Location is very close to the main tourist attractions. Excellent value for money.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Mittelklassehotel zum Luxuspreis
text:
Habe dieses Hotel auf Grund der relativ guten Bewertungen bei Tripadvisor gebucht. Kann aber nicht verstehen, wie man dieses Hotel so gut bewerten kann. Als ich das Zimmer betrat war ich erst mal geschockt. Ein kahler gefliesster Raum mit einem schmuddligen Teppich. Im Zimmer, wie auch im ganzen Hotel war ein Geruch nach Mottenkugeln. Das Zimmer hat keinen Kuehlschrank! Alle elektrischen Leitungen sind aufputz verlegt.Die Zimmertuer laesst jeden Laerm durch. Neben meinem Zimmer war auch noch das Servicezimmer. Da ich ein Zimmer nach hinten hatte hielt sich der Laerm von aussen in Grenzen. Enstrechend ar allerdings der Anblick. Das Zimmer ist auch im Lonely Planet empfohlen (Midrange). Aber der Preis passt nicht zum Hotel.

Das Fruehstueck war ok. Allerdings lief eine Kuechenschabe ueber das Tischtuch.

Einziger Vorteil ist in meinen Augen die zentrale Lage.Aber wenn man vor die Tuer geht dann muss man erst mal ueber die campierenden Inder auf dem Gehsteig. NIcht gerade die beste Strasse.

Fazit: Das naechste mal lieber wieder in eine internationale Kette. Da kann man sich auf die Qualitaet verlassen, auch in Indien.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: London calling...
text: Nothing wrong with this place and the atmosphere is similar to the Bed & Breakfast Hotel in the London. It is centrally located and close to the Cornish were Bombay ‘hangs out’. Nice for a walk at night. Rooms are large and the Internet is working. Breakfast is good as well as the overall service.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: ALLWAYS GOOD
text: i have stayed at west end three times and i think its a good hotel the location is convenient for me and the services are also great, you don't have to fuss around for taxis or anything the staff is also really nice and are always available when you need anything at anytime of the day and night, the restraunts great to and there are a few more outside as well which are great
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Good location and value
text: We had a few days stop over in Mumbai and wanted somewhere in the south to stay that was fairly cheap. Having looked at plenty of outrageously expensive places we found this and decided to give it a go. The room was very large and air conditioned, the bathroom was newly done with nice tiles and a new shower. I couldnt raise any problems with our room, it was clean and had everything we needed including a flat screen TV. The location is good- about 10 minutes scroll to marine parade. It can be a bit scary walking back at night as you walk over the railway and down some dark roads- we didn't have any problems though and taxis are always a cheap option. The staff were friendly. there was a good breakfast selection. I would stay again.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: un hôtel à l'ancienne...
text: Hôtel parfaitement bien situé à Colaba, dans l'extrême sud de Mumbai. Légèrement en retrait. On nous a donné une suite un peu vieillotte mais très confortable et surtout très propre. Pas de clim mais des ventilateurs dans le salon et la chambre. Nous coupions les ventilateurs pour dormir et ma fois nous n'avions pas trop chaud. La salle de bain était très bien avec une vraie baignoire. Le restaurant où nous avons déjeuné le premier jour offrait une belle carte pas trop chère, et de la bière fraîche... Ce qui est rare dans ce quartier plutôt musulman et aux excellents restaurants végétariens... Le personnel est très prévenant, les taxis devant l'hôtel évitent la marche à la recherche d'un véhicule: le portier explique au chauffeur où nous souhaitons aller, les liftiers sont charmants et souriants. Il est possible d'aller à pied de l'hôtel à la gare de Churchgate (500 mètres) voir l'arrivée de Dabbawalla à 11h30 et leur retour à 14h30. C'est un spectacle incroyable. On peut aussi aller à pied à IndiaGate, sur Marine Drive... C'est un endroit assez calme et proche de tout ce qu'on peut visiter à Mumbaï . J'ajouterai que je n'ai pas vu de bestioles bizarres! tout était parfaitement propre bien qu'un peu vieillot.J'ajouterai aussi que la gentillesse du personnel et de la direction est très agréable: nous devions quitter l'hôtel à 5h du matin pour prendre un avion, on nous a apporté dans la chambre à 4h 30 un excellent petit déjeuner! J'oubliais, tous les matins, 2 bouteilles d'eau dans la chambre! une bouilloire et des sachets de thé et de café.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: oui, si vous etes en transit, non pour du tourisme
text:
situation : Bof, en face d'un grand hopital, rien à faire de particulier autour. envirronement sale et cour des miracles sur le trotoir.
chambre : spacieuse, propre, confort moyen, deco 1960, clim peu bruyante, manque d'eclairage et de modrenisation.
prix : cher pour le standard
personnel : peu prèsent, liftier pour l'ascenseur, heureusement j'aurais eu peur de rester bloquer dedant.
petit dej : nous avons fuit odeur nosëabonde.
notre conclusion : un hotel de transit relativement confort, oui, mais pas plus.
placeInfo/address: 45 New Marine Lines, Mumbai 400020 India

title: Great Location

title: A nice hotel to line up to!
text:
Recently I stayed here for three nights on a business trip and here is my feedback.

The Good:

-	Location: Right in front of Swami Narayan Mandir, right next to Dadar Railway station, this hotel is in the heart of a commercial district. 
-	Great food joints to have different kinds of food be it Udupi style or Punjabi
-	Three very good Vada pav joints within a minute walking distance from the hotel. Gorge yourself with Vada pav and related snacks
-	Many mouth watering street vendors right outside the hotel making fresh Dosas, Sandwiches, Chat etc
-	The rooms are well done and well furnished
-	The bathroom is well maintained. Was impressed with immediately outflow of hot water from the shower.
-	The AC works perfectly
-	The mattresses and pillows are very comfortable, giving you the most required, good night’s sleep.
-	A DVD player is a a surprise addition to the room amenities
-       The Wi-Fi was quite good & fast

The Bad:

-	the breakfast spread and taste is quite ordinary. Hard Idlis,  tasteless chutneys disappoint you right in the morning. The fresh Dosa they offer is a saving grace
-	It is not a hotel built grounds up. It has been clearly refurbished. All the wood and furnishings can make you feel a bit crowded 
-	The prices are slightly on the higher side, which I guess, is mainly for the location.

The Ugly:

-	Nothing that I can think of.

Overall Verdict: Definitely a hotel, worth staying, both for the families and business travellers. The overall positives outweigh the negatives.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Greetings from Ramee Guestline Hotel, Dadar!

Many thanks for the fantastic header and your lovely review. Our location, ambience, recreational options and personalised services harmonise to ensure that guests enjoy every moment of their stay with us. Delighted to read that our hotel gave you the much deserved respite from monotony and you liked our proximity to all the happening places nearby. It is good to know that you liked our modern amenities and comfortable accommodation. However, we regret the lapses in our culinary offerings and have shared your concerns with the relevant departments for taking requisite measures. 
We look forward for you to return, with our promise of a remarkable stay.

Best Regards,

General Manager

title: Excellent Service in a great price
text:
The reason I say it is excellent is because I had to pay only 1500 per room I could get what I could wish for. The room had an attached bathroom. It was clean and hygienic. We were a group of 5 adults and a kid. So we booked two rooms and things were smooth. We anyway did not want a room with too many luxury as we were gonna be in the room only to sleep over in night and have a wash after we come from the beach.

The beach is just 'Cross the Road' distance away. The owner of the guest house also provide lunch & dinner was at reasonable cost. I don't remember what she had cooked the day we went but I remember my Family was very happy with the food. All in all a good stay for reasonable price

title: Wedding function
text:
We have wedding in mumbai therefore,we have booked 15 rooms for our wedding guests coming from out stations . Hotel manager Mr. Rangeet nagare and Mr.dinesh madiwal head of sales marketing both are very very helpful to us since start from booking till end. Both of them have help us give us special rates and also help us in early check in & late check out.
They have also arrange special items in breakfast to give our guests more varieties in food with options. 
The hotel is centrally located with all amenities & top in class. Internal environment of hotel is very peaceful & homely. The staff of the hotel is very friendly & helpful starting from check in to check out. Also room service is very prompt. 
Food is very very tasty at the restaurant at reasonable price.
I will give five star to hotel with overall performance in price, quality & hospitality. And my special thanks to Mr. Rangeet nagare & 
Mr. Dinesh madiwal for giving their 100% to  satisfied my all guests a give them pleasant and comfortable stay. 
From Jayesh kubadia

title: Bad experience
text: This used to be my favourite hotel about 3 years back when I stayed here atleast 8-10 times over two - three year period. However this time it was really bad. I had booked two rooms well in advance for my family. However we were allotted two rooms on different floors. Instead of a double bed, two bedded rooms were allotted. Worst still, there was a lot of noise during the night till 5 am in the morning because of a marriage party perhaps. Booking in advance could not save us from all these. I have decided not to stay here again. The earlier warmth and concern for guest was totally absent now.

title: Great stay and courteous staff
text:
Stay date: 07 Oct 2015 till 18 Oct 2015
Room: 406

Got to use the services for 11 days and here is the feedback

Positives
1. Helpful staff and smiling always
2. Food is great both room service and restaurant serving breakfast
3. Breakfast spread is decent
4. WiFi is great but at times fluctuated during the stay
5. Location is excellent... Right next to dadar station
6. Check in and check out was smooth

Negatives
1. Only hotel I have ever seen so far charging you ~Rs 100 for ice. Very surprised
2. While no comments for for pricing but a bottles of Pepsi with a market rate of Rs 40 was charged at ~Rs 250.
3. Quality of linen needs to approve as there were stains observed thrice during the stay on towels and need sheets. Got it changed
4. With due respect to the individual, the house keeping staff collecting laundry had a bandage on his hand. Suggest the hotel refrain then from customer interfacing roles and use them for backend job

Cheers
AM

Hope you would give us another chance to serve you soon in near future,
 
Warm Regards,
Ranjeet Nagare

title: conveniently located
text: Small but good hotel. Conveniently located. Well maintained rooms. Restaurant is homely and staffs are friendly. Buffet breakfast is good too. Food on menu tends to be a little too spicy, make it a point to tell the waiter to be less generous with the spices. Rooms are comfortable, room service, laundry service is prompt. Parking facility with round the clock security is a bonus. Front office staffs are helpful and efficient.

title: No value for money
text: I stayed in this hotel for a duration of about 2 weeks in the month of April 2015. The hospitality is very poor, the hotel doesn't provide pickups from the railway station and the behavior of the reception staff is very rude. The rooms are very small in the first 6 floors and also the bathrooms haven't been maintained well. Since I was on a business trip I had to stay in this hotel as it was a company provided accommodation otherwise I would have definitely changed it. I won't recommend anyone to go for this hotel

title: terrible experience
text:
I stayed in executive room on 4th May night. The drainage pipe in the bathroom was chocked and this leads to overflow of water all over. The room service was very poor. The plates in the room were not cleared after dinner despite reminding room service three times. I found one hotel boy in my room in the morning in my absence when I came back from breakfast. Front office executive told me that they have duplicate access card and they check the room during the absence of the guests that whether they are there or left the hotel. Really strange. This is not a secure environment for guests and their belongings. Anyone can enter the room anytime !!
Above all front office executive is not customer friendly and not ready to listen anything. I will never recommend this hotel to any one.
